Description: THESE FUNDS SUPPORT THE FURTHER DEVELOPMENT AND ADMINISTRATION OF THE TRIBE'S WATER QUALITY STANDARDS AND CERTIFICATIONS PROGRAM. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO FINALIZE TRIBE'S WATER QUALITY STANDARDS FOR EPA APPROVAL. THE TRIBE WILL ALSO PERFORM OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY ON THE PURPOSE AND IMPORTANCE OF DEVELOPING WATER QUALITY STANDARDS.   THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $28,500.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO COORDINATE AND CONDUCT THE REGIONAL TRIBAL OPERATIONS COMMITTEE MEETINGS. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DEVELOPING THE MEETING AGENDAS, PLANNING LOGISTICS, AND MANAGING THE ACTIVITIES AT EACH MEETING.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $305,110.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO DEVELOP THE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES TO INCLUDE COMMUNITY OUTREACH ON COMPOSTING, UPDATE THE INTEGRATED SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN, FOLLOW UP ON THE BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT, CONDUCT AN ASSESSMENT OF THREE BURIED/PARTIALLY BURIED OPEN DUMPS, UPDATE THE INTEGRATED SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN AND ATTEND MEETINGS AND TRAININGS IN ORDER TO DEVELOP CAPACITY IN THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $112,383.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO DEVELOP THE BUENA VISTA RANCHERIA OF ME-WUK INDIANS OF CALIFORNIA'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. THIS AWARD PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF 93,000 FOR THE PERIOD OF 10/1/19 THROUGH 9/30/20.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AWARD WILL PROVIDE GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (GAP) FUNDS TO THE HO-CHUNK NATION IN SUPPORT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES. THE FUNDS WILL ENABLE THE TRIBE TO ASSESS, MONITOR, AND DEVELOP STRATEGIES FOR PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE HO-CHUNK NATION WILL CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN AND ENHANCE THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH PROGRAM TO ENSURE THE TRIBE HAS THE ABILITY AND TECHNICAL RESOURCES TO RESPOND TO POTENTIAL HEALTH HAZARDS AND POTENTIAL ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS. HO-CHUNK NATION WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL JURISDICTIONS TO ADDRESS AREAS OF CONCERN AND ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPROPRIATE REGULATORY AGENCY. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE HO-CHUNK NATION. 
ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THE TRIBE WILL:

1. WORK ON LOCAL, REGIONAL, AND NATIONAL POLICY RELATED TO ENERGY, CLIMATE CHANGE, AIR, WATER PROTECTIONS, AND WASTE REDUCTIONS. 
2. DEVELOP AND ENHANCE THE TRIBES RELATIONSHIP WITH STATE AND FEDERAL PARTNERS ON JOINT ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES. 
3. PURSUE FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAMS WHERE THOSE PROGRAMS INTERSECT WITH THE NATION'S ENVIRONMENTAL AND JURISDICTIONAL NEEDS.
4. MANAGE THE DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH FOR THE HO-CHUNK NATION TO BUILD ON CORE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM COMPETENCIES.
5. EDUCATE AND INFORM THE HO-CHUNK LEADERSHIP AND THE COMMUNITY TO INCREASE AWARENESS ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND THE POTENTIAL AFFECTS TO THE HO-CHUNK NATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE DELIVERABLES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE HO-CHUNK NATION.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM GRANT PROVIDES FUNDING TO OMAHA NATION TO BUILD ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT CAPACITY. THIS INCLUDES THE PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT AND ESTABLISHMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION PROGRAMS IN INDIAN COUNTRY. GAP SUPPORTS THE OPERATION OF CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS AND GIVES FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH ACTIVITIES, MANAGEMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE, UPDATING THE EPA TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN, AND CLIMATE CHANGE AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ACTIVITIES. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO ESTABLISH AND BUILD ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY DESIGNED TO LEAD TO ENVIRONMENTAL IMPROVEMENTS ON THE SHINNECOCK INDIAN NATION LAND.  WORKPLAN TASKS INCLUDE ENVIRONMENTAL PLANNING AND ASSESSMENT; MANAGEMENT AND DISPOSAL OF SOLID WASTE; DEVELOPMENT OF A WATER QUALITY PROGRAM THAT FOCUSES ON SURFACE WATER (OCEAN WATER) AND GROUND WATER (DRINKING WATER) ISSUES THAT IMPACT RESERVATION LANDS; DEVELOPMENT OF AN AIR QUALITY PROGRAM; DEVELOPMENT OF A CULTURALLY BASED ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION PROCESS; AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION.

THIS GRANT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE PAMUNKEY INDIAN TRIBE FOR PROGRAM CAPACITY BUILDING: PLANNING, DEVELOPING, AND ESTABLISHING AN INTEGRATED TRIBAL WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN, EPA-TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN, AND ESTABLISHING THE FOUNDATION FOR AN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM WHILE EDUCATING OUR TRIBAL COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT, AND ESTABLISHMENT OF AN ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY PROGRAM TO ENABLE THE ONEIDA INDIAN NATION TO APPROPRIATELY IMPLEMENT SUSTAINABILITY AND WASTE DIVERSION/REDUCTION PROGRAMS, AND TO MONITOR SUCH PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT ONEIDA INDIAN NATION LANDS (INCLUDING LANDS HELD IN TRUST BY THE U.S. GOVERNMENT FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE NATION WITHIN THE ONEIDA INDIAN NATION RESERVATION) IN ORDER TO ENABLE THE NATION TO CONTINUE AND ENHANCE ITS STEWARDSHIP OF ITS ENVIRONMENT AND RESOURCES AND TO CONSERVE AND IMPROVE THE VALUE OF SUCH RESOURCES FOR THE NATION'S CURRENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS.
ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: 1. DEVELOPING THE ASSESSMENT AND PLANNING FOR AN ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY PROGRAM; 2. BUILDING CAPACITY FOR A SUSTAINABLE MANAGEMENT OF FOOD WASTE PROGRAM; 3. BUILDING CAPACITY FOR THE ONEIDA NATION TO OPERATE AND FURTHER DEVELOP AN ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY PROGRAM; 4. DEVELOPING THE OPERATIONS AND SUPPORT OF AN ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY PROGRAM; AND 5. ENSURING THE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY PROGRAM SUPPORTS THE GOALS OF ONEIDA NATION'S EPA TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES WILL BE REPORTED TO EPA ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AT PROGRAM REVIEW MEETINGS OR VIA TELECONFERENCE OR VIRTUAL MEETINGS. SOME ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A WRITTEN NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND STRATEGIC PLAN, AN INCREASE IN CAPACITY OF THE NATION TO MONITOR AND INCREASE FOOD WASTE RECYCLING, THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMITTEE TO GUIDE THE ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY PROGRAM, THE DEVELOPMENT OF A SELF-SUSTAINING OPERATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY PROGRAMS, AND THE CREATION OF AN ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY PROGRAM THAT SUPPORTS THE NATION'S EFFORTS TO CONTINUE AND ENHANCE ITS STEWARDSHIP OF ITS LANDS AND RESOURCES IN ORDER TO CONSERVE AND IMPROVE THE VALUE OF SUCH RESOURCES FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS.
THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS THE CITIZENS OF THE ONEIDA INDIAN NATION.

THIS GRANT PROVIDES FUNDING TO CONTINUE TO ALLOW THE ONEIDA INDIAN NATION TO PLAN AND DEVELOP ITS CAPACITY BUILDING PROGRAM. THE ONEIDA INDIAN NATION WILL USE DRONE AND OTHER TECHNOLOGY TO HELP BUILD CAPACITY TO ENABLE IT TO EVENTUALLY IMPLEMENT AND ENFORCE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION PROGRAMS FOR THE NATION'S ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES, AND TO MONITOR SUCH RESOURCES, THROUGHOUT ONEIDA INDIAN NATION LANDS (INCLUDING LANDS HELD IN TRUST BY THE US GOVERNMENT FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE NATION WITHIN THE ONEIDA RESERVATION). THESE ACTIVITIES WILL ENABLE THE NATION TO CONTINUE, AND ENHANCE, ITS STEWARDSHIP OF ITS ENVIRONMENT AND RESOURCES AND TO CONSERVE AND IMPROVE THE VALUE OF SUCH RESOURCES FOR THE NATION'S CURRENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE WIND RIVER TRIBES' (EASTERN SHOSHONE AND NORTHERN ARAPAHO) ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO BUILD AND SUSTAIN THE ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY OF THE WIND RIVER TRIBES. THE  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE CONDUCTING MEETINGS TO DISCUSS THE REESTABLISHMENT OF AN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM, REPORT ON PROGRESS, HIRE ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF AND APPLY FOR A NEW GAP GRANT. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE MONTHLY MEETINGS WITH EPA STAFF, QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS TO THE EPA, THE APPROPRIATE AND EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF EPA FUNDING, AND MEASURES TO IMPROVE AND PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE THE EASTERN SHOSHONE AND NORTHERN ARAPAHO TRIBAL MEMBERS AND RESIDENTS OF THEIR RESERVATION. NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ARE ANTICIPATED AT THE TIME OF THE AWARD.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO THE PAMUNKEY INDIAN TRIBE TO DEVELOP ITS NATURAL RESOURCES DEPARTMENT AND HIRE A NATURAL RESOURCES DIRECTOR. THE DIRECTOR WILL TAKE TRAINING AND BEGIN TO ADVOCATE FOR THE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL INTERESTS BY ATTENDING MEETINGS, PARTICIPATING ON CONSULTATIONS, AND NETWORKING WITH OTHER LOCAL, STATE, FEDERAL, ACADEMIC AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE DIRECTOR WILL ALSO DEVELOP AND FINALIZE AN EPA/TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN (ETEP), A QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN, AND FINANCIAL GRANT MANAGEMENT POLICES AND PROCEDURES. ACTIVITIES:THE DIRECTOR WILL BE SETTING UP ADMINISTRATIVE AND FINANCIAL POLICIES TO ENSURE PROPER EXECUTION OF THE GRANT. THE TRIBE WILL BE ATTENDING MEETINGS, CONSULTATIONS, AND OTHER EVENTS THAT ARE PERTINENT TO THE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL INTERESTS AND PRIORITIES. THE GRANT WILL PROVIDE FOR REFUSE SERVICE TO RESIDENTS AND THE GOVERNMENT ON THE RESERVATION. LASTLY, THE TRIBE WILL BE DEVELOPING AND FINALIZING THE EPA TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN (ETEP). SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES FOR THIS PROJECT ARE THE HIRING OF A NATURAL RESOURCES DIRECTOR THAT WILL OVERSEE EXECUTION OF THE GRANT. THAT DIRECTOR WILL PARTICIPATE IN ENVIRONMENTAL TRAINING, NETWORKING, AND ADVOCACY FOR THE TRIBE.  THE NATURAL RESOURCES DIRECTOR WILL OVERSEE THE YEAR-LONG REFUSE SERVICE CONTRACT FOR RESIDENTS AND THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PAMUNKEY INDIAN TRIBE RESERVATION. LASTLY THE NATURAL RESOURCES DIRECTOR WILL DEVELOP AND FINALIZE INTERNAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES ON PROPER EXECUTION OF THE GAP GRANT. THE BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE PAMUNKEY INDIAN TRIBE.

DESCRIPTION:IN THIS MULTI-YEAR WORKPLAN, THE CHILKAT INDIAN VILLAGE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY THROUGH MEETING THE GOALS IN THE GAP WORKPLAN.  THEY WILL CONTINUE TO EFFECTIVELY MANAGE THE GAP AWARD, KEEPING ALL RECORDS CURRENT AND SUBMITTED TO EPA IN A TIMELY MANNER.  THEY WILL GATHER BASELINE WATER QUALITY DATA UNDER AN EPA APPROVED QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN AND WILL BEGIN TO ADDRESS BOTH INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY CONCERNS.  THE TRIBE WILL RESEARCH AND RESPOND TO FEDERAL AND STATE PERMITTING PROCESSES FOR LARGE PROJECTS THAT IMPACT TRIBAL RESOURCES.  THEY WILL ALSO CONTINUE TO ADDRESS SOLID WASTE ISSUES BY IMPROVING LANDFILL MANAGEMENT, MAINTAINING THE RECYCLING CENTER AND SECURING TRAINING FOR TRIBAL STAFF. THE BENEFICIARIES ARE THE MEMBERS OF THE CHILKAT INDIAN VILLAGE TRIBE IN KLUKWAN, ALASKA.  ACTIVITIES:TRIBAL ADMINISTRATOR AND ACCOUNTING STAFF WILL MANAGE ADMINISTRATIVE AND ACCOUNTING REQUIREMENTS OF THE GRANT.  CIV STAFF WILL RECEIVE TRAININGS TO BETTER DELIVER CORE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM ACTIVITIES.  THE ENVIRONMENTAL PLANNER WILL WORK WITH THE WATER QUALITY CONTRACTOR TO GATHER BASELINE WATER QUALITY DATA TO PROTECT TRIBAL TRADITIONAL WATERS IN THE CHILKAT VALLEY. THE TRIBE WILL SEEK PARTNERSHIPS AND FUNDING FOR OVERALL AIR QUALITY TESTING AND DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE INDOOR/OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY. THE ENVIRONMENTAL SPECIALIST WILL WORK WITH THE WATER QUALITY CONTRACTOR ON BASELINE WATER QUALITY TESTING FOLLOWING TRIBE'S QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:A REPORT WILL BE EMAILED TO PROJECT OFFICER EACH QUARTER AND BASELINE DATA RESULTS WILL BE UPLOADED TO EPA WQX DATABASE.  OTHER DELIVERABLES INCLUDE MEETING NOTES, OFFICIAL AGREEMENTS AND MEMORANDUMS OF UNDERSTANDING.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE COMMUNITY OF CHILKAT.

DESCRIPTION:THE WRANGELL COOPERATIVE ASSOCIATION, A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBAL GOVERNMENT WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD ITS ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM TO ADDRESS IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE; ENVIRONMENTAL THREATS TO SUBSISTENCE FOODS. THEY WILL WORK TO MINIMIZE AND REDIRECT THE SOLID WASTE STREAM INTO COMPOST AND RECYCLING OPPORTUNITIES. THEY WILL ENCOURAGE WATER CONSERVATION AND CLEANLINESS.  THE STAFF WILL PARTICIPATE IN ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND NETWORKING WITH REGIONAL ENTITIES.ACTIVITIES:ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF WILL IGAP COORDINATOR WILL CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN DETAILED OFFICE MANAGEMENT AND ADMINISTRATOR PRACTICES; RESEARCH AND APPLY FOR APPROVED ENVIRONMENTAL GRANTS; ORGANIZE FILES/RESOURCES; SUPERVISE EMPLOYEES (I.E. LABORERS), PARTICIPATE IN REGIONAL AND LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL TRAININGS, PARTICIPATE IN ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH EFFORTS; GATHER BASELINE DATA ON HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOMS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:REGULAR ASAP.GOV DRAWDOWNS AND DOCUMENTATION, TIMESHEETS, PAYROLL RECORDS, EMPLOYEE WORKLOGS AND EVALUATIONS; UPDATES WILL BE POSTED TO FB AND LOCAL BULLETIN BOARDS AND THE MONTHLY IGAP NEWSLETTER; WATER WISE TIPS -POST ON SOCIAL MEDIA AND RADIO; COPIES OF SOLID WASTE EDUCATIONAL AND OUTREACH MATERIALS, PHOTOS, WEIGHT
LOGS AND COMPOSTING DRAFT PLANS WILL BE SUBMITTED VIA QUARTERLY REPORTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE CRAIG TRIBAL ASSOCIATION (CTA) WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM BY ENSURING PROPER GRANT MANAGEMENT. THEY WILL DEVELOP AND PROVIDE COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND CONTINUE TO GATHER BASELINE WATER QUALITY DATA.  IN ADDITION, THEY WILL WORK WITH ELDERS TO HELP PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT OF TRADITIONAL HARVESTING AREAS. FINALLY, THEY WILL USE PURPLE AIR MONITORS TO GATHER BASELINE AIR QUALITY DATA.  ACTIVITIES:THE CRAIG TRIBE WILL SUBMIT QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS, FEDERAL FINANCIAL REPORTS AND OTHER REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION TO EPA ACCORDING TO GRANT AGREEMENT. THEY WILL ENCOURAGE TRIBAL PARTICIPATION THROUGH COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT AND EDUCATION ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND CONTINUE ENVIRONMENTAL COLLABORATION WITH TRIBES, MUNICIPALITIES AND LOCAL AGENCIES. CTA WILL ASSIST IN EARTH DAY AND ELECTRONIC RECYCLING EVENTS. THEY WILL DEVELOP EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS ON TRADITIONAL HARVESTING METHODS AND PROCESSING TO EDUCATE YOUTH AND TRIBAL MEMBERSHIP WITH TRADITIONAL KNOWLEDGE ON THE IMPORTANCE OF SUSTAINING A HEALTHY ENVIRONMENT FOR TRADITIONAL RESOURCES. FINALLY, THEY WILL PROVIDE DATA TO THE NATIONAL PHYTOPLANKTON MONITORING NETWORK (NOAA) AND SEATOR; WILL REVIEW THE PURPLE AIR QAPP AND CONTINUE GATHERING ENVIRONMENTAL BASELINE DATA TO ENSURE THE HEALTH OF TRIBAL RESOURCES.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES FROM CTA'S WORK INCLUDE SIGN UP LISTS/PHOTOS/PICTURES; NEWS ARTICLE AND WEIGHTS/AMOUNTS OF ELECTRONICS RECYCLED; ENVIRONMENTAL FACEBOOK PAGE POSTINGS, WEBSITE UPDATES, COMMUNITY CLEANUPS, FLYERS, CTA READER BOARD, AND TRIBAL NEWSLETTER. THEY WILL ALSO CREATE A LIST OF THE TOP 3-5 TRIBAL COUNCIL WATER QUALITY AREAS OF CONCERN. FINALLY, CTA WILL UPDATE AND REVIEW THEIR PURPLE AIR QAPP.  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE MEMBERS OF THE TRIBE.

DESCRIPTION:PRIMARY PROJECT OBJECTIVES INCLUDE PROVIDING ONSITE AND REMOTE ASSISTANCE TO TRIBAL DRINKING WATER AND WASTEWATER UTILITIES, PROVIDING ASSISTANCE TO VILLAGE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS IN THE AREAS OF GRANTS MANAGEMENT AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, PROVIDING EDUCATION TO COMMUNITIES ON NEW AND EXISTING ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH CONCERNS, AND PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING TO MEMBER TRIBES ON DEVELOPING, UPDATING, AND PRACTICING EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT PLANS.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE UPDATING A GAP STAFF MANUAL, PROVIDING ONSITE AND REMOTE TRAINING TO VILLAGE WATER TREATMENT AND WASTEWATER TREATMENT OPERATORS, CONDUCTING SANITARY SURVEYS, PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON GRANTS MANAGEMENT, DEVELOPING TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS, ATTENDING ONE OR MORE CONFERENCES FOR CONTINUING EDUCATION ON ENVIRONMENTAL TOPICS, PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO MEMBER TRIBES ON EMERGENCY PLANNING, AND HELPING TO PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO NATURAL DISASTERS IN MEMBER TRIBES' VILLAGES.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS, TRIP REPORTS, A HIGH-SPEED INTERNET LIST, PRESENTATIONS, PAMPHLETS, FLYERS, VILLAGE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLANS, AND PHOTOS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED COMMUNITY HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION THROUGH PROPERLY MANAGED WATER AND WASTEWATER UTILITIES, SELF-SUFFICIENT TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS, AND IMPROVED HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH IN TRIBAL COMMUNITIES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE TANANA CHIEFS CONFERENCE MEMBER TRIBES.

DESCRIPTION: THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE ALATNA VILLAGE TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS IN FY24.ACTIVITIES:AFTER SEVERAL YEARS OUT OF THE PROGRAM, ALATNA WILL USE THIS NEW GAP GRANT TO BUILD ITS FINANCIAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY, MANAGE THE GRANT FINANCIALLY, BUILD ITS SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT CAPACITY, AND CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH AND EDUCATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE AN EPA-TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN, QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS, TRIP REPORTS, THE ANNUAL SF-425, REPORTS ON RECYCLING, HOUSEHOLD HAZARDOUS WASTE, AND E-WASTE COLLECTED, A BACKHAUL INVENTORY, DOCUMENTATION ON THE LANDFILL PERMIT, MONTHLY LANDFILL INSPECTION LOGS, A PROJECT PLAN FOR THE LANDFILL, A MONTHLY NEWSLETTER, AND SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED STAFF AND COUNCIL KNOWLEDGE OF GRANTS ADMINISTRATION AND MANAGEMENT, KNOWLEDGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND PROTECTION, AND ABILITY TO RESPOND TO LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS; COMPLIANCE WITH PROGRESS AND FINANCIAL REPORTING REQUIREMENTS, DEVELOPMENT OF POSITION DESCRIPTIONS, AND AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE TRIBE'S BOOKKEEPING PRACTICES, AS WELL AS IMPROVED SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT, POLLUTION PREVENTION AND RECYCLING WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, A REDUCTION IN THE AMOUNT OF RECYCLABLES AND HAZARDOUS WASTES ENTERING THE LANDFILL, AND INCREASED COMMUNITY AND COUNCIL AWARENESS OF SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE'S POTENTIAL ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS AND KNOWLEDGE OF POLLUTION PREVENTION PRACTICES AND RECYCLING OPPORTUNITIES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE MEMBERS OF THE ALATNA TRIBE.

DESCRIPTION:ALLAKAKET VILLAGE COUNCIL WILL USE THE FUNDS TOWARD ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY BUILDING, ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS, SOLID WASTE CAPACITY BUILDING, AND SOLID WASTE IMPLEMENTATION. ACTIVITIES:THE TRIBE WILL MANAGE THE ADMINISTRATIVE AND FINANCIAL ASPECTS OF THE GRANT, ATTEND VIRTUAL AND IN-PERSON TRAININGS, UPDATE CRITICAL DOCUMENTS, EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY THROUGH NEWSLETTERS AND SOCIAL MEDIA, WORK TO INVOLVE YOUTH IN THE LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL OBSERVATION NETWORK, ASSIST THE YUKON RIVER INTER-TRIBAL WATERSHED COUNCIL ON WATER QUALITY MONITORING, MANAGE SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE AND RECYCLING, CONDUCT A COMMUNITY CLEAN-UP, MANAGE THE LANDFILL, AND ORDER A STORAGE CONTAINER FOR STORING GAP EQUIPMENT AND ITEMS FOR BACKHAUL. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE PROGRESS REPORTS, TRIP REPORTS, UPDATED DOCUMENTS, NEWSLETTERS, SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS, PHOTOS, WATER QUALITY TEST RESULTS, TRAINING CERTIFICATES, BACKHAUL INVENTORY. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED ABILITY TO MANAGE FEDERAL FUNDS, INCREASED AWARENESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND SOLUTIONS, INCREASED ABILITY TO AFFECT CHANGE IN THE COMMUNITY, COMMUNITY EDUCATION ON SOLID WASTE AND RECYCLING, COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN GAP ACTIVITIES, INCREASED AWARENESS ABOUT WATER CONTAMINANTS, REMOVAL OF RECYCLABLES AND SCRAP WASTE, LESS WASTE IN THE LANDFILL, PROPER DISPOSAL OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS, AND STAFF TRAINING ON SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE ISSUES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE MEMBERS OF THE ALLAKAKET TRIBE.

DESCRIPTION:IN THIS WORK PLAN, THE HOONAH INDIAN ASSOCIATION AIMS TO BUILD THE ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY OF THE TRIBE AND IGAP DEPARTMENT. THIS INCLUDES CONTINUING TO GATHER BASELINE DATA ON HABS, OCEAN ACIDIFICATION, AND NUTRIENTS, AS WELL AS CONTINUING THE STREAM TEMPERATURE MONITORING BASELINE STUDY. THE ETEP WILL BE UPDATED TO TRACK COMPLETED AND FUTURE PROJECTS. AN ENVIRONMENTAL PRESENCE WILL BE ESTABLISHED THROUGH THE CREATION OF A DIGITAL ARCHIVE OF TRADITIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL KNOWLEDGE SPECIFIC TO HIA. A WATER QUALITY BASELINE DATA COLLECTION PROGRAM WILL BE ESTABLISHED AND A CLIMATE ADAPTATION PLAN SPECIFIC TO HOONAH WILL BE CREATED. 
ACTIVITIES:THE HOONAH INDIAN ASSOCIATION STAFF (HIA) WILL PUBLISH A QUARTERLY NEWSLETTER AND ATTEND IGAP TELECONFERENCES AND WEBINARS. THEY WILL ALSO PARTICIPATE IN THE SOUTHEAST TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONFERENCE AND HOONAH STEWARDSHIP COUNCIL MEETINGS. IN ADDITION, THEY WILL ATTEND TRAININGS ON PHYTOPLANKTON MONITORING, COLLECTION, AND ANALYSIS PROVIDED BY TRIBAL NOAA, AND UNIVERSITY STAFF. WEEKLY BASELINE DATA WILL BE COLLECTED, AND TOXIN ANALYSIS CONDUCTED, WITH THE RESULTING DATE ENTERED INTO THE SEATT DATABASE. FURTHERMORE, THE STREAM TEMPERATURE MONITORING EQUIPMENT WILL BE INSPECTED AND MAINTAINED, AND DATA WILL BE COLLECTED TWICE PER YEAR BY HIA STAFF. FINALLY, HIA IS BUILDING A GIS DATABASE OF TRADITIONAL AREAS WITH HIGH ECOLOGICAL AND CULTURAL IMPORTANCE. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE CREATING NOTES, AGENDAS, AND SUMMARIES OF EVENTS. DATA IS ENTERED INTO THE SEATOR DATABASE AND PROGRESS REPORTS ARE GENERATED. A DRAFT CLIMATE ADAPTATION PLAN IS ALSO BEING DEVELOPED. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THESE EFFORTS ARE THE HOONAH INDIAN ASSOCIATION AND THE COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:AKIAK NATIVE COMMUNITY WILL USE GAP FUNDING TO ADDRESS PRIORITY ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS IN THE COMMUNITY. ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF WILL FOCUS ON TECHNICAL TRAINING AND BUILDING MANAGEMENT CAPACITY, WITH THE GOAL OF ACHIEVING PROGRAMMATIC GROWTH TO MAINTAIN MEANINGFUL PARTICIPATION IN EPA PROGRAMS. KEY AREAS OF FOCUS INCLUDE WATER QUALITY MONITORING, IMPLEMENTING SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES, AND ADDRESSING AIR QUALITY ISSUES THROUGH EDUCATION AND OUTREACH.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES PERFORMED UNDER THE GRANT WILL FOCUS ON TECHNICAL TRAINING TO BUILD ADMINISTRATIVE AND ENVIRONMENTAL SKILLS RELEVANT TO THE TRIBE'S PRIORITIES. A KEY ELEMENT OF THIS PROGRAM INVOLVES BUILDING A PATH TOWARDS INCREASED COLLABORATION WITH MULTIPLE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS AND AGENCIES, ULTIMATELY ENHANCING MEANINGFUL PARTICIPATION IN EPA PROGRAMS. FINALLY, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION WILL BE INSTRUMENTAL TO ACHIEVING ENVIRONMENTAL RESULTS, INCLUDING SOLID WASTE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES FROM AKIAK NATIVE COMMUNITY WILL INCLUDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS TO EPA, OUTLINING PROGRESS TOWARDS ENVIRONMENTAL RESULTS IN PRIORITY AREAS. IN ADDITION, TRIP REPORTS WILL OUTLINE TECHNICAL CAPACITIES GAINED FROM ATTENDING RELEVANT TRAININGS AND CONFERENCES. FINALLY, EDUCATIONAL PAMPHLETS, WASTE INVENTORIES, AND WATER QUALITY MONITORING RESULTS WILL DEMONSTRATE THE ACCOMPLISHMENTS RESULTING FROM THESE WORK PLAN COMMITMENTS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE MEMBERS OF THE TRIBE.

DESCRIPTION:PRIMARY PROJECT GOALS INCLUDE: 1. RE-ESTABLISH NENANA'S ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE AND IMPLEMENT GAP WORKPLAN ACTIVITIES;  2. RE-ESTABLISH THE WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, INCLUDING RESEARCH, PLANNING, TRAINING, COLLABORATION, AND IMPLEMENTATION ACTIVITIES; AND 3. CONDUCT COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL MEETINGS AND CLASSROOM PRESENTATIONS AND ACTIVITIES TO ENGAGE COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN BEING GOOD STEWARDS OF THE LAND.ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF ATTENDANCE AT TRAINING ON WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN DEVELOPMENT AND BACKHAUL PROTOCOLS, AS WELL AS COORDINATING WITH LOCAL ENTITIES TO CREATE SUSTAINABLE WASTE MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES. COMMUNITY OUTREACH WILL BE CONDUCTED THROUGH NEWSLETTER DISTRIBUTION, COMMUNITY EVENTS, AND SCHOOL PRESENTATIONS. IMPLEMENTATION ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE BUYING RECYCLING SUPPLIES AND EQUIPMENT, SORTING AND STAGING MATERIALS, AND TRANSPORTING MATERIALS TO A RECYCLING CENTER.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE AN EPA-TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN, TRIP AND COUNCIL REPORTS, MEETING NOTES, AN INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN, STATISTICS ON MATERIALS BACKHAULED, NEWSLETTERS, PRESENTATIONS, AND PHOTOS. OUTCOMES INCLUDE BUILDING COMMUNITY AWARENESS, DEVELOPING PARTNERSHIPS, AND A SUSTAINABLE WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE NENANA RESIDENTS AND THE SURROUNDING ENVIRONMENT.

DESCRIPTION:PRIMARY OBJECTIVES INCLUDE:  EXPAND SOLID WASTE PLANNING, PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, AND IMPLEMENTATION BY COORDINATING WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS TO DEVELOP SUSTAINABLE STRATEGIES;  ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAMMATIC DEVELOPMENT THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN CONFERENCES, WEBINARS, AND TRAINING;  COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, INCLUDING THE LATEST DEVELOPMENTS IN WATER QUALITY AND WASTE MANAGEMENT; AND COLLECT BASELINE WATER SAMPLES WITH EXPERT ASSISTANCE. ACTIVITIES:1. EXPAND NORTHWAY'S WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM BY ADDING LANDFILL FENCING AND SIGNAGE, CONDUCTING TRENCH AND FILL OPERATIONS, PURCHASING A DUMP TRAILER, COORDINATING WITH PARTNERS, AND CONDUCTING BACKHAUL TRIPS. RECORD TYPES OF MATERIALS BACKHAULED AND PROGRAM INCOME RECEIVED. 2. EDUCATE STAFF THROUGH ATTENDING CONFERENCES, TRAINING, AND WEBINARS; REVIEW AND UPDATE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND THE EPA-TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN ANNUALLY. 3. PROVIDE COMMUNITY EDUCATION ON CONTAMINATED SITES, WATER QUALITY, AND SOLID WASTE ISSUES AT COUNCIL MEETINGS AND COMMUNITY EVENTS; POST INFORMATION ON SOCIAL MEDIA. 4. WORK WITH PARTNERS TO COLLECT, ANALYZE, AND REPORT WATER QUALITY SAMPLING DATA.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE COPIES OF PHOTOS, LANDFILL LOGS, SOLID WASTES STATISTICS, PROGRAM INCOME, MEETING NOTES, TRIP REPORTS, POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, PRESENTATIONS, ATTENDANCE LISTS, AND WATER QUALITY REPORTS AND STATISTICS. OUTCOMES INCLUDE PROTECTING HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH THROUGH EXPANDED WASTE MANAGEMENT, INCREASED KNOWLEDGE FOR STAFF, COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, AND ESTABLISHMENT OF BASELINE WATER QUALITY DATA. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE NORTHWAY COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND THE SURROUNDING ENVIRONMENT.

DESCRIPTION:PROVIDER REGIONAL TECHNICAL TRAINING TO MEMBERS OF UPPER COLUMBIA UNITED TRIBES (UCUT).  ADVANCE EFFORTS TO ADDRESS TRANSBOUNDARY MINING THREATS AND IMPACTS. SUPPORT UCUT MEMBER TRIBES WITH PUBLIC OUTREACH, POLLUTION PREVENTION AND OTHER WATER RESOURCE PRIORITIES. SUPPORT UCUT MEMBER TRIBES TO IMPLEMENT GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (GAP) AND ASSOCIATED EPA TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN PRIORITIES.ACTIVITIES:INCREASE UPPER COLUMBIA UNITED TRIBES (UCUT) MEMBERS CAPACITY AS IT RELATES TO THEIR KNOWLEDGE BASE AND ADVANCING THEIR CAPABILITIES TO IMPLEMENT THEIR PRIORITIES. INCREASE THE UNDERSTANDING OF THE BEST AVAILABLE SCIENCE BY BRINGING TRIBES, NATIONS, AND REGIONAL EXPERTS TOGETHER TO SHARE KNOWLEDGE ON TRANSBOUNDARY MINING ISSUES. GIVE GUIDANCE FOR UCUT MEMBER TRIBES TO IDENTIFY MEANINGFUL ACTIONS THAT RESULT IN WATER POLLUTION PREVENTION OR REDUCTION. ENHANCE UCUT MEMBER TRIBES' CAPACITY TO MANAGE THE COMPLEXITY OF PRIORITIZING, DEVELOPING, AND IMPLEMENTING MEANINGFUL ACTIONS TO ACHIEVE THEIR EPA TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN PRIORITIES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF THE UPPER COLUMBIA UNITED TRIBES (UCUT) MEMBER TRIBES TO FULFILL THE GOALS OF THEIR EPA TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLANS (ETEPS). PROTECT ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH BY COLLABORATING AND ASSISTING WITH ORGANIZING, UCUT MEMBER TRIBES WITH BC FIRST NATIONS, TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE THREATS AND IMPACTS OF TRANSBOUNDARY MINING PROJECTS AND PROPOSALS. INCREASED SUPPORT FOR POLLUTION PREVENTION AND TRIBAL WATER RESOURCE PRIORITIES. INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF THE UCUT MEMBER TRIBES TO IMPLEMENT PRIORITIES IDENTIFIED IN THEIR GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (GAP) WORK PLANS AND ETEPS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS WORK PLAN CONTAINS TWO PRIMARY COMPONENTS; MAINTAIN STAFF TO PERFORM ADMINISTRATIVE FUNCTIONS AND PROVIDE TRAINING EVENTS AND PEER MATCHING FOR TSWAN GENERAL MEMBERSHIP AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. TRAINING EVENTS AND MEETING FOCUS ARE SELECTED BY MEMBERSHIP EACH YEAR AND PRIORITY IS GIVEN TO EVENTS THAT FILL KNOWLEDGE GAPS FOR RURAL COMMUNITIES. THE GOAL IS TO PROVIDE AT LEAST THREE TRAINING EVENTS PER YEAR. THE LONG TERM OBJECTIVE OF THE ORGANIZATION IS TO DECREASE LEVELS OF POLLUTANTS BEING IMPROPERLY HANDLED AND DISPOSED OF DUE TO INCREASED AND IMPROVED WASTE SYSTEMS AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT BY AND THROUGH THE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL DOCUMENTS IN TRIBAL COMMUNITIES. ACTIVITIES:GRANT MANAGEMENT, PLAN, ORGANIZE, ATTEND, AND PARTICIPATE IN TSWAN REGULARLY SCHEDULED MEETINGS, ATTEND TRAINING, PROVIDE TRAINING, MAINTAIN DOCUMENT LIBRARY, AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO MEMBER TRIBES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:GRANT MANAGEMENT FORMS, MEETING AGENDA AND MINUTES, TRAINING ATTENDANCE ROSTERS, POLICY AND PROGRAM TEMPLATES CREATED, AND AN UPDATED WEBSITE DOCUMENT LIBRARY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT IS TO CONTINUE BUILDING THE AFFILIATED TRIBES OF NORTHWEST INDIANS (ATNI)'S ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY AS LEADERS IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY BY COORDINATING SHARED OBJECTIVES AND LOCALIZED STRATEGIES WITH ITS MEMBER TRIBES. ATNI WILL CONTINUE TO WORK TOWARD ESTABLISHING ITSELF AS A LEADING INTERTRIBAL ORGANIZATION TO COMMUNICATE, COORDINATE, AND PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES FOR TRIBES IN THE GREATER NORTHWEST.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE INFORMATION SHARING ON ENVIRONMENTAL BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, ADDRESSING NATURAL RESOURCE CHALLENGES FOR TRIBES IN THE GREATER NORTHWEST AND ESTABLISHING TRIBAL NATURAL RESOURCE POLICY PRIORITIES, AND SERVING AS A RESOURCE CLEARINGHOUSE FOR ATNI MEMBER TRIBES REGARDING NEW AND PROPOSED ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS AND REGULATIONS THAT MAY AFFECT NATURAL RESOURCES, AMONG OTHER ACTIVITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE, AMONG OTHERS, TECHNICAL RESOURCE DOCUMENTS AND REPORTS, TO BE SHARED WITH ATNI MEMBER TRIBES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE BUILDING CAPACITY TO SUPPORT ATNI MEMBER TRIBES IN DEVELOPING THEIR OWN ENVIRONMENTAL POLICIES, BUILDING CONSENSUS AROUND REGIONAL TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICIES, AND SUPPORTING MEMBER TRIBES BY PROVIDING INPUT ON ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY PRIORITIES THAT IMPROVE OVERALL AIR AND WATER QUALITY. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE TRIBAL MEMBERS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ADVANCE ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAMMATIC WORK THROUGH TRAINING AND CONFERENCE ATTENDANCE, REVIEWING/UPDATING POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, AND COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL OUTREACH/EDUCATION; CONDUCT INDOOR AIR QUALITY RESEARCH, PLANNING, AND PROGRAM ESTABLISHMENT; ENHANCE THE SOLID WASTE PROGRAM THROUGH PLANNING, MANAGEMENT, IMPLEMENTATION, AND SUSTAINABILITY STRATEGIES; AND ESTABLISH A BASELINE WATER QUALITY SAMPLING DATABASE.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: ADMINISTRATIVE - ATTEND TRAINING, UPDATE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, COLLABORATE WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, PUBLISH A NEWSLETTER, AND CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION MEETINGS; INDOOR AIR QUALITY - ATTEND TRAINING, LEAD DISCUSSIONS AT COMMUNITY MEETINGS, DEVELOP AN INDOOR AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN, AND COLLECT BASELINE INDOOR AIR QUALITY DATA; SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT - ATTEND TRAINING, UPDATE THE INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN, BUY TOOLS, SUPPLIES, AND EQUIPMENT, PROVIDE COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, AND PURCHASE A METAL SHED KIT;  WATER QUALITY - ATTEND CONFERENCES AND TRAINING, CONDUCT WATER SAMPLING, FACILITATE PUBLIC OUTREACH, AND POST SIGNS WITH INFORMATION ON WATER CONDITIONS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS, NEWSLETTERS, COMMUNITY FEEDBACK, ATTENDANCE LISTS, PRESENTATIONS, PHOTOS, TRIP REPORTS, AND AN UPDATED INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE STRONG ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP BEHAVIORS THROUGH COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT, SUSTAINABLE WASTE MANAGEMENT, AND WATER QUALITY EDUCATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND THE ENVIRONMENT OF BEAVER VILLAGE.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRINCE OF WALES TRIBAL STEWARDSHIP CONSORTIA (POW-TSC) SERVES THE FOUR MEMBER TRIBES OF HYDABURG, CRAIG, KLAWOCK AND KASAAN ON PRINCE OF WALES ISLAND.  IN THIS MULTIYEAR WORKPLAN THE POW-TSC WILL CONDUCT EDUCATION AND OUTREACH REGARDING SOLID WASTE REDUCTION, INCLUDING RECYCLING, COMPOSTING, HOUSEHOLD HAZARDOUS WASTE, WHITE GOODS; UPDATE INTERGOVERNMENTAL AGREEMENT WITH MEMBER TRIBES AND MUNICIPAL GOVERNMENT TO CONTINUE ADDRESS SOLID WASTE REDUCTION; PROVIDE TRAININGS THAT REFLECTS PRIORITIES FOR THE POW TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS; REGISTER AND COMPLETE AHERA PROGRAM TRAINING, AND OTHER APPLICABLE TRAININGS; POW-TSC WILL HOST TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL COALITION MEETINGS; PLANNER AND TECHNICIAN WILL REVIEW ETEPS FROM MEMBER TRIBES.ACTIVITIES:POW-TSC WILL ASSIST CREATING AN ILLEGAL DUMP AND DERELICT VEHICLE INVENTORY; AN INVENTORY OF SITES WITH LEAD-BASED PAINT; PROVIDE TRAINING; CREATE AND OUTREACH AND EDUCATION PROGRAM ON ASBESTOS AND LEAD BASED PAINTSUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ILLEGAL DUMP AND DERELICT VEHICLE INVENTORY SHEET TO TRIBAL COUNCILS' AND EPA PROJECT OFFICER; COPIES OF TRAINING ADVERTISEMENTS AND CERTIFICATES OF COMPLETION; ALIGNED WORK PLAN AND ETEPS WILL BE PROVIDED TO EPA PROJECT OFFICER; INVENTORY OF SITES IN TRIBAL COMMUNITIES THAT CONTAIN ASBESTOS AND/OR LEAD-BASED PAINT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS WORK PLAN CONTAINS THREE COMPONENTS. COMPONENT 1 IS FOCUSED ON BUILDING THE CORE ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY TO MANAGE A TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST NORTHWEST PORTLAND AREA INDIAN HEALTH BOARD (NPAIHB) IN BUILDING CAPACITY AND DEVELOPING PROGRAMS TO PROTECT THE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENT AND HEALTH. THE PRIMARY PURPOSES OF THIS AWARD INCLUDE: GAP MANAGEMENT AND CAPACITY BUILDING. STATUS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PUBLIC HEALTH IN TRIBAL CLIMATE CHANGE PLANS, GOALS AND ACTIVITIES. PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED IN THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: CREATE WRITTEN ADMINISTRATIVE, TECHNICAL AND RECORD-KEEPING PROCEDURES, POLICIES AND GUIDELINES FOR MANAGING THE GAP GRANT PROGRAM. DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN A SYSTEM FOR TRACKING ALL REPORTS, ACTIVITIES, EXPENSES AND FINAL OUTPUTS AND DELIVERABLES. RESEARCH AND PARTICIPATE IN OTHER ONLINE AND IN PERSON TRAININGS RELEVANT TO CLIMATE CHANGE AND EJ RELATED TO TRIBES. COLLECT INFORMATION FROM ALL TRIBES ON CURRENT AND PAST PLANS, VULNERABILITY ASSESSMENTS AND ACTIVITIES RELATED TO CLIMATE CHANGE. RESEARCH GROUPS THAT INTEGRATE PUBLIC HEALTH INDICATORS AND GOALS INTO CLIMATE CHANGE PREPARATION, MITIGATION AND ADAPTATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:
DELIVERABLES, OUTCOMES, AND INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: CREATE A TRAINING PLAN FOR STAFF THAT REFLECTS THE CAPACITY-BUILDING PRIORITIES FOR THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. BUILD STAFF CAPACITY TO MANAGE THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. INTEGRATE ENVIRONMENTAL PUBLIC HEALTH GOALS, OBJECTIVES AND ACTIVITIES INTO CLIMATE CHANGE PLANS AND ACTIVITIES TO ENSURE THE LONG-TERM PROTECTION OF PUBLIC HEALTH IN THE FACE OF CLIMATE CHANGE. STRENGTHEN STAFF CONFIDENCE, SKILLS, AND KNOWLEDGE RELATED TO GRANT MANAGEMENT (ADMINISTRATIVE) AND CLIMATE CHANGE SCIENCE, THE VALUE AND IMPORTANCE OF TRADITIONAL ECOLOGICAL KNOWLEDGE (TEK), AND HOW PUBLIC HEALTH IS AFFECTED BY CLIMATE CHANGE (TECHNICAL). CREATE AND MAINTAIN MEANINGFUL COALITIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS TO EXPAND THE OVERALL PROJECT IMPACT AND REACH, AND ULTIMATE OUTCOMES.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE EKLUTNA NATIVE VILLAGE, TRIBAL MEMBERS, AND THE LOCAL PUBLIC.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: INCREASING TRIBAL ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY TO RESPOND TO LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS; INCREASING TRIBAL PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY TO ASSESS LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES; INCREASING COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND ACTIONS PROTECTIVE OF THE ENVIRONMENT; DECREASING AMOUNTS OF RECYCLABLES AND HAZARDOUS WASTES ENTERING LANDFILL; AND INCREASING TRIBAL TECHNICAL CAPACITIES TO PRIORITIZE ENVIRONMENTAL NEEDS AND DEVELOP PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS THEM.   ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: PERFORMANCE REPORTS; FINANCIAL REPORTS; COPIES OF OUTREACH MATERIALS; EVENT SUMMARY REPORTS; RIVER RESTORATION PLANS; AND AN EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT PLAN.

DESCRIPTION:MCGRATH NATIVE VILLAGE COUNCIL WILL USE GAP FUNDS TO BUILD ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY FOR MANAGEMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE; INCREASE COMMUNICATIONS CAPACITY TO CONDUCT GENERAL PUBLIC EDUCATION, AWARENESS, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, AND INFORMATION EXCHANGE ON ISSUES RELATED TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; AND BUILD SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT CAPACITY THROUGH SOURCE REDUCTION ACTIVITIES INCLUDING WASTE MINIMIZATION, RECYCLING, HOUSEHOLD HAZARDOUS WASTE COLLECTION, USED OIL COLLECTION, JUNK VEHICLE REMOVAL, AND ELECTRONIC WASTE COLLECTION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MAINTAINING AN ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE, ATTENDING RELEVANT ENVIRONMENTAL CONFERENCES AND TRAININGS, ENCOURAGING ENVIRONMENTAL AWARENESS IN COMMUNITY THROUGH QUARTERLY NEWSLETTERS/FLYERS, AND PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT'S (PSA'S), SPONSORING ENVIRONMENTAL AWARENESS ACTIVITIES WITH APPROPRIATE AGE GROUPS IN THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY CENTER, RECRUITING YOUTH IN GRADES 8-12TH TO DEVELOP AN ENVIRONMENTAL YOUTH GROUP, CONTINUING SOURCE SEPARATION ACTIVITIES, CONDUCTING AN EDUCATION/OUTREACH EVENT ON WASTE MANAGEMENT, AND BUILDING AN INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM (IWMP) AND LANDFILL OPERATIONS PLAN (LOP).SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE QUARTERLY NEWSLETTERS/FLYERS, PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT'S (PSA'S), AN INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM (IWMP), A LANDFILL OPERATIONS PLAN (LOP), TRIP REPORTS, QUARTERLY REPORTS, AND ANY PHOTOS OF EVENTS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED CAPACITY TO MANAGE THE ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE, IMPLEMENT WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS, AND FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF METHODS TO CONDUCT GENERAL PUBLIC EDUCATION, AWARENESS, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, AND INFORMATION EXCHANGE ON ISSUES RELATED TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS MCGRATH NATIVE VILLAGE COUNCIL.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF SHAKTOOLIK IN BUILDING CAPACITY AND DEVELOPING PROGRAMS TO PROTECT THE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENT AND HEALTH. THE PRIMARY PURPOSES OF THIS AWARD INCLUDE: MANAGEMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE. SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT. SCRAP METAL/APPLIANCE/VEHICLE MITIGATION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED IN THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: INDIAN (ENVIRONMENTAL) GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (IGAP) STAFF WILL MAKE REGULAR AND FREQUENT DRAWDOWN REQUESTS TO APPLY GAP AWARD FUNDS AS NEEDED TO PAY ALL INVOICES TO THE TRIBE FOR MONTHLY COSTS. THE PROGRAM WILL STAY CURRENT WITH SYSTEM FOR AWARD MANAGEMENT (SAM), AUTOMATED STANDARD APPLICATION PAYMENTS (ASAP), AND GRANTS.GOV REGISTRATION. COMPLETE A COMMUNITY ASSESSMENT IDENTIFYING COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES AND COMPLETE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL NEWSLETTERS. CONDUCT COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ABOUT SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT TECHNIQUES SUCH AS DIVERTING HAZARDOUS WASTE MATERIALS FROM OUR LANDFILLS, MINIMIZING WASTE GENERATION, REUSING PRODUCTS, AND DOING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ABOUT CONTAMINATES AND OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES. WORK WITH THE CITY OF SHAKTOOLIK TO ENCOURAGE COLLECTING HOUSEHOLD HAZARDOUS WASTE. HOST ENVIRONMENTAL EVENTS SUCH AS THE COMMUNITY CLEAN-UP, E-WASTE, OR ANY OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL ACTIVITIES, IN COLLABORATION WITH COMMUNITY AND REGIONAL ENTITIES. PARTICIPATE WITH KAWERAK, INC BACKHAUL PROGRAM BY SHIPPING UNIVERSAL WASTE DEFINED AS E-WASTE, BATTERIES, FLUORESCENT LIGHT BULBS, AND ALASKANS FOR LITTER PREVENTION AND RECYCLING (ALPAR) RECYCLING ALUMINUM CANS. IGAP STAFF AGREED TO MAINTAIN THE LANDFILL AND DO TRASH HAULS ON MONDAY, WEDNESDAY, AND FRIDAY. IGAP WILL WORK WITH THE CITY TO DEVELOP ORDINANCES FOR THE LANDFILL AND A BUDGET FROM COLLECTION FEES THAT WILL HELP WITH THE DEVELOPMENT AND SUSTAINABILITY OF THE PROGRAM. BACKHAUL PROGRAM SHALL BE RECORDED WITH TRACKING LOGS, TIMESHEETS, WEIGHTS, AND THE STAGING OF BACKHAUL WASTE SUCH AS FLUORESCENT LIGHTS, LEAD-ACID BATTERIES, AND E-WASTE. APPLIANCE AND MOTOR VEHICLE PREPARATION. REMOVAL OF LIQUID WASTE AND WASTE OF ANY NONMETALLIC PIECES. BURN OFF USING SMART ASH BURNER. REMOVING METAL WASTE COMMUNITY-WIDE. COMMUNITY/BUSINESS INVOLVEMENT AND PROVIDE REMOVAL OF MEMBERS METAL WASTE ON THEIR PROPERTY OR PROPERTIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES, OUTCOMES, AND INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: GAP STAFF WILL EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND ANY SOLID WASTE ISSUES. ENSURE THAT NO SOLID WASTE IS DUMPED OUTSIDE THE DESIGNATED LANDFILL PIT. MITIGATE ANIMAL WASTE, BATTERY, LIGHTBULB, ELECTRONIC, AND METAL WASTE AND PROPERLY DISPOSE OUTSIDE OF THE LANDFILL, IN DESIGNATED AREAS.  COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND INFORM THE COMMUNITY ABOUT WHAT MAY BE PLACED IN THE LANDFILL PIT AND WHAT CANNOT BE PLACED INTO THE LANDFILL PIT, BY USING POSTERS, FLYERS, NATIVE VILLAGE OF SHAKTOOLIK (NVOS) FACEBOOK POSTS. MITIGATE AND PROPERLY DISTRIBUTE METAL WASTE FROM NONMETAL WASTE. REMOVE FREON, OIL, FUEL, RADIANT COOLANTS, AND ITEMS THAT AREN'T METAL WASTE. DISPOSE OF NONMETALLIC MATERIALS PROPERLY. CLEAN AFFECTED HOLDING AREAS AND BURY METAL WASTE IF APPLICABLE. MITIGATE METALS THAT CAN BE SHIPPED OUT VERSUS WHAT CAN BE BURIED. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROPOSED ENVIRONMENTAL CLEANUP AND EDUCATION ARE ALL MEMBERS OF THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF SHAKTOOLIK COMMUNITY

DESCRIPTION:THE SOUTHEAST ALASKA TRIBAL OCEAN RESEARCH (SEATOR) NETWORK WILL WORK WITH TRIBAL PARTNERS TO FACILITATE AND COORDINATE SAMPLES FOR BASELINE DATA ON MARINE AND FRESHWATER TOXIN PRODUCING ALGAE AND OCEAN CHEMISTRY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND AND EDUCATE THE TRIBAL COMMUNITIES WITHIN SOUTHEAST ALASKA. APPLICANT WILL CREATE A REGIONAL WATER QUALITY TESTING PROGRAM, DECISION MATRIX TO SUPPORT TRIBES SO THEY CAN ADDRESS THEIR SPECIFIC WATER QUALITY CONCERNS. THIS WORKPLAN WILL BUILD CAPACITY FOR SEATOR MEMBER TRIBES BY ANALYZING AND DISTRIBUTING BASELINE SHELLFISH TOXIN, OCEAN ACIDIFICATION, AND CONTAMINANT DATA.
ACTIVITIES:THE SEATOR CONSORTIA WILL DEVELOP AN ADMINISTRATIVE FILE TRACKING SYSTEM, ATTEND AND/OR HOST SOUTHEAST TRIBAL, GUARDIAN NETWORK AND SEATOR WEBINARS AND TRAININGS, PROVIDE TRAINING AT ANNUAL SEATOR WORKSHOP ON CURRENT PROJECTS, INCLUDING SHELLFISH TOXINS, OA, AND MERCURY CONTAMINATION IN SUBSISTENCE FOODS; APPLICANT WILL REVIEW PARTNER ETEPS ANNUALLY. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:REPORTS TO EPA PROJECT OFFICER, DATA IN ONLINE DATABASE; CREATE MATRIX OF SHARED GOALS AND ACTIONS WITH EPA PROJECT OFFICER.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE CONSORTIA MEMBER TRIBES; AND THEIR COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF AKUTAN WILL CONTINUE TO ESTABLISH AN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. THEY WILL BUILD ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY FOR IMPROVED GRANT MANAGEMENT AND DAILY ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM OPERATIONS. A FOCUS AREA IS  TO CONDUCT A RECYCLING EFFORT WITHIN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, INCLUDING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO IMPROVE AWARENESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP. THE TRIBE WILL CONDUCT A COLLABORATIVE SOLID WASTE IMPROVEMENT PROJECT WITH THE CITY, DEVELOP A MARINE DEBRIS PROGRAM, AND INCREASE KNOWLEDGE/RESOURCES FOR HEALTHIER, MORE SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITY.ACTIVITIES:WORKPLAN ACTIVITIES WILL INVOLVE ADMINISTRATIVE CONTINUED CAPACITY BUILDING AS WELL AS TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY BUILDING. THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE CRITICAL SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS BY BACKHAULING WASTES WHICH PREVENTS CONTAMINATION BY UNIVERSAL WASTES INTO WATERWAYS AND ON LAND. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THRU ACTIVITIES TO INCLUDE COMMUNITY WIDE COLLECTION OF MATERIALS THAT CAN BE RECYCLED OR REPURPOSED TO REDUCE WASTE WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, EXTEND THE LIFE OF THE LANDFILL. A MARINE DEBRIS PROJECT WILL INVOLVE ACTIVITIES TO THE DEBRIS. COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES ARE INTEGRAL TO THIS PROJECT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:AKUTAN AND THE EPA EXPECT THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY TO EXPAND BY ENGAGING THE TRIBAL RESIDENTIAL COMMUNITY. OUTCOMES WILL INVOLVE ADMINISTRATIVE CONTINUED CAPACITY BUILDING AS WELL AS TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY BUILDING. THE TRIBAL WILL CONTINUE TO FOCUS ON OUTCOMES THAT ARE SPECIFIC TO CRITICAL SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS. MARINE DEBRIS ACTIVITIES WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED HEALTH AMONG TRIBAL MEMBERS THRU PROVEN STRATEGIES AND INITIATIVES. COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION IN SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS CHANGES BEHAVIOR PATTERNS, ENABLING BOTH EPA AND THE TRIBE TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.  OVERALL, THESE EFFORTS WILL SERVE THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY FOR YEARS TO COME.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: 1. PROGRESSIVE ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT WILL STRENGTHEN THE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM; 2. WORKING WITH COMMUNITY PROVIDING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION BY EXPLORING A VARIETY OF ENVIRONMENTAL TOPICS AND ISSUES WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO ENCOURAGE INVOLVEMENT IN ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND PROJECTS. FOCUS ON THE PRIORITIES IN THE TRIBE'S ETEP AND CURRENT WORKPLAN; 3. CONTINUE TO IMPROVE SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH PARTNERS, TRAINING FOR STAFF, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION. CONTINUE TO CONDUCT PUBLIC EDUCATION, AWARENESS, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, AND INFORMATION EXCHANGE ON ISSUES RELATED TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.ACTIVITIES:COMPONENT 1: ALASKA TRIBAL CONFERENCE ON ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT AND THE ALASKA FORUM ON THE ENVIRONMENT CONFERENCES WILL BE ATTENDED BY THE ENV. COORDINATOR AND ENV. ENVIRONMENTAL MEETINGS, WORKSHOPS, AND WEBINARS WILL ATTEND BY THE EC. THE ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT WILL COLLABORATE WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ON WASTE MANAGEMENT, CLIMATE CHANGE, AND OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES. THE EC WILL REVIEW THE EPA-TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN AND UPDATE IT AS NEEDED. ENVIRONMENTAL AND ADMIN STAFF AND COUNCIL MEMBERS WILL REVIEW/UPDATE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.  COMPONENT 2: WORKING WITH COMMUNITY PROVIDING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION BY EXPLORING A VARIETY OF ENVIRONMENTAL TOPICS AND ISSUES WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO ENCOURAGE INVOLVEMENT IN ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND PROJECTS. LAND IN AND AROUND TRIBAL COMMUNITY WILL BE CLEANED UP IN ANNUAL SPRING CLEAN UP. 
COMPONENT 3: BUILDING TRIBAL CAPACITY TO CO MANAGE REMOVAL SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE / CONTINUING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE RECYCLING PROGRAMS. KNOWLEDGE AMONG COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL BE INCREASED OF PROGRAMS.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ATTEND TRAININGS AND CONFERENCES ON ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT: AFE, ATCEM, GAP MANAGEMENT, AND OTHER NATIONAL CONFERENCES ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES.
WORK WITH CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER TO ENSURE ALL REQUIRED REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED IN A TIMELY MANNER.  REPORTS WILL BE GIVEN TO EPA AND OTHER FUNDING AGENCIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE GRANT AGREEMENT.  OUTREACH TO COMMUNITY REGARDING EVENT.  COMMUNITY WILL BE NOTIFIED THROUGH FLYERS, NEWSLETTER, VHF ANNOUNCEMENTS.  ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF WILL ORGANIZE START DATE/TIME.  PARTICIPANTS AND SPONSORS WILL BE ACKNOWLEDGED. IF DONATIONS ARE RECEIVED, PRIZES AND REFRESHMENTS WILL BE PROVIDED.  STAFF WILL PLAN AND HOLD THE EVENT. A HEALTH AND SAFETY BRIEFING WILL BE PROVIDED PRIOR TO THE CLEAN-UP EVENT.

DESCRIPTION:THE ORGANIZED VILLAGE OF KAKE WILL BUILD ITS ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM GRANT MANAGEMENT BEST PRACTICES, AND THROUGH PARTICIPATING IN ENVIRONMENTAL TRAINING INCLUDING HAZ-MAT TRAINING; CONDUCTING TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION; UPGRADING SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, GATHERING BASELINE ENVIRONMENTAL INFORMATION ON WATERSHED HEALTH AND HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOMS; PARTICIPATING IN THE SOUTHEAST ALASKA INDIGENOUS TRANSBOUNDARY COMMISSION ON MINING ISSUES OF CONCERN TO THE TRIBE. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE ORGANIZED VILLAGE OF KAKE'S TRIBAL MEMBERS.  ACTIVITIES:ANNUAL AUDIT, PARTICIPATING IN ENVIRONMENTAL TRAINING; GATHERING BASELINE ENVIRONMENTAL DATA; PARTICIPATING IN ENVIRONMENTAL MEETINGS ON TRANSBOUNDARY MINING.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:REPORTS SUBMITTED TO EPA ON A TIMELY BASIS, BASELINE DATA COLLECTED ACCORDING TO APPROVED QAPP; PHOTOS OF SOLID WASTE IMPROVEMENTS.  BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE ORGANIZED VILLAGE OF KAKE'S TRIBAL MEMBERS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF UNALAKLEET IN BUILDING CAPACITY AND DEVELOPING PROGRAMS TO PROTECT THE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENT AND HEALTH. THE PURPOSES OF THIS AWARD INCLUDE: ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT.  ENVIRONMENTAL CLEANUP AND ASSESSMENT. OUTDOOR AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY.  TRAINING/OFFICE MANAGEMENT.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED IN THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: CONDUCT VULNERABILITY/RISK ASSESSMENT USING TRADITIONAL ECOLOGICAL KNOWLEDGE AND CONTEMPORARY SCIENTIFIC DATA/TOOLS. PERFORM THE CROSS SHORE PROFILE AND THE WATER QUALITY MONITORING FIELD SAMPLING PER THEIR RESPECTIVE QAPPS. COMPLETE A RECYCLING AND REMEDIAL EFFORTS ASSESSMENT AND REPORT. PREPARE A REPORT RECOMMENDING ACTIONS TO IMPROVE RECYCLING. COMPLETE A POLLUTION PREVENTION ASSESSMENT AND REPORT. INCORPORATE RECYCLING IMPROVEMENTS. RECYCLE EWASTE, ALUMINUM CANS, AND NO 1 PLASTIC BOTTLES. DOCUMENT INDOOR AIR QUALITY FOR HOUSING UNITS OCCUPIED BY ELDERS AND PARENT(S) WITH YOUNG KIDS. REVIEW AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO TRIBE'S PEST PREVENTION STRATEGIC PLAN AND THE NVU'S PEST PREVENTION WAIVER. UPDATE IF NECESSARY.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES, OUTCOMES, AND INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: DEVELOPMENT OF TRIBAL SPECIFIC AMBIENT ADAPTATION AND MITIGATION STRATEGIES AND RECOMMENDATIONS. LENGTHEN THE LIFE SPAN OF THE LANDFILL BY RECYCLING. KEEP HAZARDOUS GOODS OUT OF UNALAKLEET AND THE LANDFILL. INCREASE THE HEALTH OF THE ENVIRONMENT BY REMEDIATING POLLUTED SITES. INCREASE HUMAN HEALTH BY REMOVING CONTAMINATION SOURCES. INCREASE UNDERSTANDING OF TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSIBILITIES. INCREASE CAPACITY TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF COMMUNITY TRIBAL MEMBERS AND THE ENVIRONMENT. IMPROVE THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: 1. PROGRESSIVE ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT WILL STRENGTHEN THE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM; 2. COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION: EXPLORE A VARIETY OF ENVIRONMENTAL TOPICS AND ISSUES WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO ENCOURAGE INVOLVEMENT IN ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND PROJECTS. FOCUS ON THE PRIORITIES IN THE TRIBE'S ETEP AND CURRENT WORKPLAN; 3. IGAP STAFF TO INCREASE TRIBAL JURISDICTION EFFICIENCY IN DEVELOPING WATER QUALITY AND DRINKING WATER PROTECTION PROGRAM AS IT RELATES TO SOLID WASTE ISSUES; STAFF ACQUIRING INITIAL TRAINING, COMPILING RELEVANT DATA FOR DEVELOPMENT DECISIONS, ENGAGING THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY ON WATER QUALITY ISSUES TOWARDS ESTABLISHING WATER QUALITY PROTECTION PROGRAM; 4. CONTINUE TO IMPROVE SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH PARTNERS, TRAINING FOR STAFF, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION; 4. CONTINUE TO EXPAND AND IMPROVE THE SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM USING OPTIMAL PRACTICES AND THE LATEST TECHNOLOGIES; ACTIVITIES:COMPONENT 1: ALASKA TRIBAL CONFERENCE ON ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT AND THE ALASKA FORUM ON THE ENVIRONMENT CONFERENCES WILL BE ATTENDED BY THE ENV. COORDINATOR AND ENV. ENVIRONMENTAL MEETINGS, WORKSHOPS, AND WEBINARS WILL ATTENDED BY THE EC. THE ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT WILL COLLABORATE WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ON WASTE MANAGEMENT, CLIMATE CHANGE, AND OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES. THE EC WILL REVIEW THE EPA-TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN AND UPDATE IT AS NEEDED. ENVIRONMENTAL AND ADMIN STAFF AND COUNCIL MEMBERS WILL REVIEW/UPDATE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.
COMPONENT 2: INCREASE AWARENESS TO COMMUNITY RESIDENTS AND TRIBAL LEADERS TOWARDS STEPS TO IMPROVING ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS
COMPONENT 3: THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ABOUT SAFE DRINKING WATER.
COMPONENT 4: BUILDING TRIBAL CAPACITY TO DEVELOP/MANAGING SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE / CONTINUING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE RECYCLING PROGRAMS. KNOWLEDGE AMONG COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL BE INCREASED OF COLLECTION PROGRAMS AND THE SOLID WASTE STREAM WILL BE MAINTAINED AT OR BEFORE TRANSPORTED TO DUMPSITE.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:
STAFF ATTENDS GAP TRAINING AND GRANT WRITING AND STRATEGIC PLANNING TRAINING THAT REFLECTS THE CAPACITY-BUILDING PRIORITIES FOR THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM SUCH AS ATCEM, FREON REMOVAL OR OTHER (ON-GOING) ACCEPTED BY EPA PROJECT OFFICER. THEY WILL ALSO GATHER RESOURCES/APPLY GRANT FUNDING PROJECTS SUPPORTING BACKHAUL/RECYCLING, CONTINUE BACKHAUL STAGING/PREPAREDNESS ACTIVITIES, EDUCATE COMMUNITY WITH RECYCLING AND SORTING PROGRAMS ON THE 'HOW TO' IN MONTHLY/QUARTERLY NEWSLETTERS.
WORK WITH SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY GROUPS ON ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS.
IGAP ASSISTANT TECHNICIAN WILL PREPARE/DISSEMINATE OUTREACH MATERIALS(ARTICLES IN TRIBAL NEWSLETTERS, FLYERS FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS RESIDENTS, WEBSITES POSTINGS, ETC.) ON THE STATUS OF RECYCLING AND COLLECTION/DISPOSAL OPTIONS AVAILABLE TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS 'ON-GOING'.
CONTRACT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WITH MELINA FAW (DEC) TO HELP FINALIZE DRAFTING THE TRIBAL INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN (IWMP), WORK/MEET WITH SOLID WASTE COMMITTEE AND NELSON ISLAND CONSORTIA.
FINALIZE FACILITY PLANNING (MOA) BETWEEN THE CITY OF NIGHTMUTE, NIGHTMUTE TRADITIONAL COUNCIL (IGAP FY 23 LANDFILL WASTE TECHNICIAN DEMONSTRATION.) 
EA WILL ORGANIZE ANNUAL COMMUNITY CLEAN-UP, LOCAL RESIDENTS AND YOUTH WILL BE ENCOURAGED TO PICK UP TRASH FOR SORTING AT THE LANDFILL.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO HOLY CROSS TRIBE TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS.  ACTIVITIES:HOLY CROSS WILL USE THE FY23 GAP GRANT TO IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF CAPACITY FOR FORMATTING AND SUBMITTING ALL REQUIRED REPORTS, BOOKKEEPING AND FINANCIAL REPORTING, DEVELOPING AND SUBMITTING THE IGAP WORK PLAN PROPOSALS, AND UNDERSTANDING ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND SOLUTIONS; IMPROVE SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT USING THE TRIBE'S SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN AND THROUGH BETTER COMMUNICATION WITH LOCAL AGENCIES; AND CLEAN UP THE COMMUNITY BY REMOVING ABANDONED VEHICLES/ HAZARDOUS WASTE/WHITE GOODS. 

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE DELIVERABLES WILL BE PROGRESS REPORTS, TRIP REPORTS, FINANCIAL POLICIES, PARTICIPATION CERTIFICATES, PHOTOS, AND A BACKHAUL INVENTORY.
THE TRIBE WILL HAVE AN ESTABLISHED ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM THAT IS SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENTED, EFFECTIVE ENVIRONMENTAL STRATEGIES FOR THE FUTURE TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, LESS SOLID WASTE ON TRIBAL LANDS RESULTING IN A CLEANER COMMUNITY, LESS PLASTIC WASTE IN THE LANDFILL, IMPROVED OPPORTUNITIES FOR RECYCLING INCLUDING HAZARDOUS WASTE (USED OIL AND HOUSEHOLD WASTE), CONTINUED IMPLEMENTATION AND ENHANCEMENT OF THE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL STRATEGIES FOR HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT, COLLECTION OF ABANDONED VEHICLES/ HAZARDOUS WASTE/ WHITE GOODS, WHICH WILL BE PROPERLY CRATED AND READY TO BE SHIPPED OUT, REDUCED CONTAMINANTS TO THE NATURAL RESOURCES THAT ARE VITAL TO SUBSISTENCE AND THE TRADITIONAL LIFESTYLE OF THE TRIBE, AND REDUCED HEALTH RISKS TO TRIBAL MEMBERS.
THE BENEFICIARY IS THE HOLY CROSS TRIBE.

DESCRIPTION:THE WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED IN THIS PROJECT INCLUDES: GAP MANAGEMENT AND CAPACITY BUILDING, GAP MANAGEMENT AND SOLID WASTE CAPACITY BUILDING, DEVELOPMENT OF HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOM PROGRAM. THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF ELIM IN BUILDING CAPACITY AND DEVELOPING PROGRAMS TO PROTECT THE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENT AND HEALTH. 
ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: COMPLETE CLOSEOUT ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING SUBMITTING FINAL PERFORMANCE REPORT AND FINAL SF-425. PERFORM SOURCE SEPARATION ACTIVITIES; RECYCLING ALUMINUM CANS AND PLASTIC BOTTLES; HOUSEHOLD HAZARDOUS WASTE SUCH AS BATTERIES, LEAD ACID BATTERIES, INK TONER, AND LIGHT BULBS; ELECTRONIC WASTE WILL BE COLLECTED FROM THE COMMUNITY TO BE RECYCLED; FREON REMOVAL WILL BE DONE WHEN NECESSARY. BACKHAUL LOG WILL BE KEPT OF ITEMS SENT TO KAWERAK INC.'S BACKHAUL PROGRAM. BOXES WILL BE PROPERLY LABELED OF CONTENTS BEFORE SHIPPED. SPRING COMMUNITY CLEANUP AND COLLECT RECYCLABLES. GAP STAFF WILL COLLECT BURNABLE MATERIAL FROM THE COMMUNITY AND UTILIZE THE TRASH BURN UNIT. BUILD CAPACITY BY ATTENDING TRAINING PROVIDED BY NSHC, OCEAN AND EARTH ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (OANDE), NOAA STAFF ON PHYTOPLANKTON MONITORING, COLLECTING, AND ANALYSIS. PARTICIPATE IN WEEKLY PHYTOPLANKTON BASELINE DATA RESEARCH, TOXIN ANALYSIS, AND DATA ENTRY INTO SHARED DATABASE HOSTED BY OANDE FOR NOAA IN ACCORD WITH NOAA'S COOPERATIVE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT. UPDATE NEWSLETTER TO SHARE WITH COMMUNITIES ON INTERPRETATION AND WHAT HABS ARE AND HOW THEY AFFECT HUMAN HEALTH AND WHAT THE DATA MEANS AND WHY IT IS IMPORTANT.

VILLAGE-BASED ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ARE BENEFITTING FROM GAINING MORE CONNECTIONS TO RESOURCES. LEGACY HAZARDOUS MATERIALS WILL NO LONGER POSE A THREAT TO UNLINED LANDFILLS IN OUR REGION WHERE OPEN BURNING OCCURS. HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT IMPROVE IN OUR REGION. VILLAGE COMMUNITIES FEEL SUPPORTED IN THEIR EFFORTS TO REMOVE LEGACY SCRAP METAL WASTE. COMMUNITIES WILL BECOME BETTER EDUCATED ABOUT IMPORTANT ENVIRONMENTAL TOPICS. EXAMPLES OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS WILL BE UPLOADED WITH QUARTERLY REPORTS AS ATTACHMENTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS FY23-FY24 PROJECT INCLUDES WASTE PROGRAM ADVANCEMENT THROUGH PLANNING AND COLLABORATION, STAFF TRAINING, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION, AND IMPLEMENTATION ACTIVITIES; PARTNERING WITH THE YUKON RIVER INTER TRIBAL WATERSHED COUNCIL ON WATER SAMPLING TO ESTABLISH BASELINE DATA; DEVELOPING A COMMUNITY EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN AND PROGRAM; AND EROSION RESEARCH, PLANNING, AND SCIENTIFIC MODELING AS IT RELATES TO CLIMATE CHANGE. ACTIVITIES:WASTE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE REMOVING AND RECYCLING APPLIANCES, ELECTRONICS, AND OTHER MATERIALS; KEEPING TRADITIONAL AREAS FREE OF WASTE; PROVIDING EDUCATION AND ACTIVITIES FOR THE COMMUNITY; COMPLETING CERTIFICATION AS A HAZARDOUS WASTE OPERATIONS AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE (HAZWOPER) TRAINER; AND CONDUCTING A HAZWOPER CLASS FOR THE COMMUNITY. WATER QUALITY ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ATTENDING THE YUKON RIVER INTER TRIBAL WATERSHED COUNCIL BIENNIAL MEETING, PROVIDING COMMUNITY EDUCATION, AND CONDUCTING BASELINE WATER SAMPLING. EMERGENCY RESPONSE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DEVELOPING AN EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN, LOCATING TRAINING RESOURCES, RECRUITING PERSONNEL, AND FORMING A LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMITTEE. CLIMATE CHANGE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONFERENCE ATTENDANCE, QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN DEVELOPMENT, CONDUCTING VISUAL AND DRONE OBSERVATIONS, COMPLETING A RISK ASSESSMENT AND ADAPTATION PLAN, AND CONDUCTING COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS; NEWSLETTERS; PHOTOS; A SMALL COMMUNITY EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN; TRIP REPORTS; COMMUNITY PRESENTATIONS AND ATTENDANCE LISTS; WATER QUALITY AND CLIMATE CHANGE DATA AND REPORTS, MEETING NOTES, AND POLICIES; AND A CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION PLAN. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE COMMUNITY   AWARENESS OF THE EFFECTS OF SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE ON HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH, INCREASED CAPACITY TO PREPARE FOR CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS THROUGH WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENT, EMERGENCY RESPONSE KNOWLEDGE AND PREPAREDNESS TO PROTECT VENETIE FROM NATURAL AND HUMAN CAUSED DISASTERS, AND AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE POTENTIAL HAZARDS OF ERODING RIVERBANKS AND DEVELOPMENT OF A MANAGEMENT PLAN. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND ENVIRONMENT OF VENETIE.

DESCRIPTION:THE NORTHWEST INDIAN FISHERIES COMMISSION PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO 20 TREATY INDIAN TRIBES IN WESTERN WASHINGTON IN ADMINISTERING THEIR NATURAL RESOURCES PROGRAMS. COMPILATION OF COMMUNICATION MATERIALS AND SUMMARY TOPICS OF INFORMATION, ISSUE SUMMARIES, TECHNICAL REPORTS. IMPROVED WATER QUALITY DATA MANAGEMENT, STORAGE, AND SHARING. IMPROVED KNOWLEDGE RELATING TO HABITAT PROTECTION AND TRIBAL ENGAGEMENT. ENHANCED TRIBAL PROTECTION OF TREATY-RESERVED RESOURCES AND HOMELANDS.

DESCRIPTION:THE DOUGLAS INDIAN ASSOCIATION (DIA) WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM WITH A MULTI YEAR WORKPLAN THAT WILL BUILD A STRONG ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE TO MANAGE THE GRANT; ADDRESS TRANSBOUNDARY MINING ISSUES; WORK WITH TRIBES AND RELEVANT AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS ON SALMON HABITAT RESTORATION AND RESILIENCY; DIA ADDRESS ISSUES OF POOR SALMON RETURNS ON THE TAKU RIVER AND OTHER NATURAL RESOURCES INTEGRAL TO TRIBAL FOOD SYSTEMS; COORDINATE WITH LOCAL COMPOST PROGRAMS TO PARTICIPATE IN THE REDUCTION OF SOLID WASTE AT OUR LOCAL LANDFILL; WORK ON IDENTIFYING AND PROTECTING THE ENVIRONMENT FOR HISTORIC AND SACRED SITES WITHIN OUR TRADITIONAL TERRITORIESACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THAT STAFF WILL ATTEND TRAINING TO UNDERSTAND GRANT MANAGEMENT; HOW TO OVERSEE THE FINANCIAL ASPECTS OF THE GRANT THROUGH REGULAR COMMUNICATION BETWEEN TRIBAL LEADERS, GAP STAFF, AND FINANCIAL DEPARTMENT AND COMPLETE REPORTING IN A TIMELY MANNER; DIA WILL WORK WITH TAKU RIVER TLINGIT FIRST NATIONS (TRTFN) TO COLLABORATE AND ADDRESS MINING ISSUES THAT IMPACT THE TAKU RIVER. EM WILL ORGANIZE DIA EPA COMMITTEE MEETINGS WHEN REQUIRED AND WORK WITH OTHER TRIBES ON CROSS-BORDER COOPERATION, ASSURING CONTAMINATION FROM MINES ARE ADDRESSED AND ON SALMON RESILIENCY ISSUES THAT IMPACT THE TAKU RIVER AND THE WATERSHED HABITAT; DIA STAFF WILL RESEARCH CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS TO SALMON AND HOW CLIMATE CHANGE SHAPES SALMON HABITAT; STAFF WILL DO RESEARCH ABOUT THE DIFFERENT TYPES OF COMPOSTING METHODS; EM, ETA, AND CULTURAL COMMITTEE, WILL INVITE ALL DIA TRIBAL ELDERS TO BE INVOLVED WITH IMPORTANT TRIBAL HISTORY KNOWLEDGE AND DECISIONS WITH IMPORTANT ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES ON TRADITIONAL TERRITORIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:TRIP REPORTS, EPA QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS; INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF SALMON RESILIENCY AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS THAT MAY CONTRIBUTE TO LOW SALMON RETURNS; INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF HOW SALMON POPULATIONS ARE MOST VULNERABLE TO CLIMATE CHANGE, CHANGING FRESHWATER AND OCEAN ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS; DIA WILL DEVELOP CORE INFORMATION OF COMPOSTING AND INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF A TRIBAL WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM; HABITAT AND CULTURAL SITE PROTECTION, SITE MONITORING REPORTS.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE DOUGLAS INDIAN ASSOCIATION TRIBAL MEMBERS AND THE JUNEAU COMMUNITY.

WEBINARS, LOCAL AND REGIONAL WORKSHOPS, MEETINGS, AND TRAININGS TO BUILD ADMINISTRATIVE AND ENVIRONMENTAL SKILLS; COLLECTING AND CONSOLIDATING TRASH AT THE LANDFILL; COORDINATING A CLEANUP EVENT AND PREPARING HAZARDOUS WASTE MATERIALS FOR BACKHAUL; ORGANIZING A CAMPAIGN TO COMBAT ROAD DUST ISSUES IN THE COMMUNITY; AND UPDATING AKIACHAK'S INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN (IWMP) WITH NEW PRIORITIES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED AWARENESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND ACTIONS TRIBAL MEMBERS MAY TAKE TO IMPROVE SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT; AIR QUALITY, AND OVERALL ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY, INCREASED COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, ENVIRONMENTAL AWARENESS, AND A STRONG TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS OF AKIACHAK NATIVE COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THIS GAP PROJECT ARE:

1. TRIBAL SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT: EXPAND SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM FOCUSING ON RECYCLING AND SUSTAINABILITY, BUILDING ON PREVIOUS WORK AND INCORPORATING NEW TECHNOLOGY. IMPROVE AND UPGRADE THE LANDFILL TO MOVE IT TOWARDS SELF-SUSTAINABILITY.
2. CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO INCREASE COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF AND PARTICIPATION IN THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. 
3. WATER QUALITY PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND EXPANSION, FOCUSING ON EFFECTS FROM MINING ACTIVITIES UPRIVER OF VENETIE AND CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION PLANNING. 
4. AIR QUALITY PROGRAM ESTABLISHMENT. DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS ISSUES SUCH AS LANDFILL OPEN BURNING, WOOD STOVES, AND DUST FROM THE ROADS, ALL OF WHICH ARE ALL CONTRIBUTING TO POOR AIR QUALITY.
ACTIVITIES:COMPONENT 1: ATTEND VIRTUAL OR IN-PERSON SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE TRAININGS OR REFRESHERS THAT WILL ADVANCE SOLID WASTE PROGRAM CAPACITY; IMPLEMENT THE FEE STRUCTURE FINALIZED IN FY22 FOR THE SOLID WASTE COLLECTION PROGRAM; EXPAND THE RECYCLING PROGRAM BY REBUILDING OLD BROKEN-DOWN DUMPSTERS AND PLACING LABELED RECYCLING BINS THROUGHOUT THE VILLAGE AND AT THE LANDFILL; COLLABORATE WITH A VARIETY OF PARTNERS TO DEVELOP A SUSTAINABLE WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM; PURCHASE WASTE MANAGEMENT SUPPLIES AS NEEDED; SORT, SEPARATE, PREPARE, AND STAGE ITEMS/MATERIALS FOR BACKHAUL IN A DESIGNATED AREA AND CONDUCT BACKHAUL; AND ASSESS OLD WOODEN STRUCTURES BEFORE DEMOLITION/ DISPOSAL OF THE RESULTING WASTE.
COMPONENT 2: ATTEND CONFERENCES, INCLUDING THE ALASKA FORUM ON THE ENVIRONMENT, THE ALASKA TRIBAL CONFERENCE ON ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT, AND THE DECEMBER GAP WORKSHOP; PROVIDE MONTHLY NEWSLETTERS TO THE COMMUNITY; HOST COMMUNITY CLEANUPS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES; AND CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMUNITY.
COMPONENT 3: COLLABORATE WITH THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF VENETIE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT, T'EE DRIIN JIK CONSERVATION DISTRICT, AND THE YUKON RIVER INTER TRIBAL WATERSHED COUNCIL ON BASELINE WATER QUALITY SAMPLING AND CLIMATE CHANGE; TAKE BASELINE SAMPLING REFRESHER TRAINING; USE THE YUKON RIVER INTER-TRIBAL WATERSHED COUNCIL UMBRELLA QAPP TO GATHER BASELINE DATA FROM UPPER CHANDALAR RIVER; AND DISCUSS ACTIVITIES WITH THE COUNCIL AND RESIDENTS AT QUARTERLY COMMUNITY MEETINGS.
COMPONENT 4: ATTEND AIR QUALITY SESSIONS AT THE AFE AND ATCEM CONFERENCES AND AIR QUALITY RELATED TRAINING; PARTNER WITH ORGANIZATIONS TO DEVELOP AN INDOOR AIR QUALITY PROGRAM; 
COMPLETE AN AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENT AND BEGIN  DEVELOPING AN AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN; AND PARTICIPATE IN R10 MONTHLY TRIBAL AIR TELECONFERENCES.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES: COPIES OF QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS, TRIP REPORTS, STATISTICS ON PROGRAM INCOME RECEIVED, PHOTOS, NEWSLETTERS, PARTICIPATION LISTS, PRESENTATIONS, WATER QUALITY QAPP, MEETING NOTES, ASSESSMENT AND DRAFT AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN.

OUTCOMES: 
-	EXPANDING AND ADVANCING VVC'S SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM WILL PROTECT HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH IN VENETIE.  
-	INCREASING COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL KNOWLEDGE THROUGH THE MONTHLY NEWSLETTER WILL IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL AND HUMAN HEALTH
-	DATA COLLECTED FROM BASELINE WATER QUALITY STUDIES WILL PROMOTE COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND IMPROVED ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH.
-	DATA RELATING TO CLIMATE CHANGE WILL BE USED TO UPDATE VENETIE'S ADAPTATION PLAN AND PREPARE TO MANAGE CHANGES IN THE LONG TERM.
-	BY PROMOTING BETTER COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES, INCLUDING SAFER WOOD STOVES, PAVING ROADS, AND OTHER WAYS TO KEEP THE DUST DOWN, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP WILL INCREASE, IMPROVING HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH. 

BENEFICIARIES: THE COMMUNITY OF VENETIE AND SURROUNDING ENVIRONMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT ENTAILS THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES.  DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN THE WATER QUALITY BASELINE ASSESSMENT FOR FRESHWATER RIVERS AND STREAMS IN LOCAL COMMUNITY. CONTINUE ENVIRONMENTAL AND CULTURAL EDUCATION TO CREATE AWARENESS ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND CONCERNS THAT ARE IMPACTING THE COMMUNITY. IMPLEMENT AND DEVELOP SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES. MAINTAIN PROGRAMMATIC AND ADMINISTRATIVE TO FURTHER STRENGTHEN CAPACITY AS A TRIBAL GOVERNMENT TO ADMINISTER THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES:RECORD DATA THAT IS COLLECTED INTO THE WATER QUALITY DATABASE, TO FURTHER DEVELOP OUR BASELINE ASSESSMENT AND ENHANCE OUR COMPREHENSIVE WATERSHED PROGRAM. 
CONTINUE TO RESEARCH AND REVIEW SOLUTIONS TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND CONCERNS THAT ARE AFFECTING THE COMMUNITY. EDUCATE COMMUNITY ON THE IMPORTANCE OF REDUCING, REUSING, AND RECYCLING TO REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF WASTE GOING INTO THE LANDFILL. MAINTAIN PROPER GRANT ADMINISTRATION AND MANAGEMENT AND CONTINUE TO COMPLETE THE COMPONENTS AND COMMITMENTS LISTED IN OUR EPA APPROVED WORKPLAN. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:CREATE A GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF THE IMPORTANCE OF PROTECTING AND PRESERVING A HEALTHY WATERSHED WITHIN NONDALTON COMMUNITY. EDUCATE THE NONDALTON YOUTH IN THE CULTURAL AND TRADITIONAL WAYS. IMPROVE AND IMPLEMENT NONDALTON RECYCLING PROGRAM TO MAKE IT MORE EFFICIENT. DEVELOP AND ADMINISTER THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND CONCERNS IN THE NONDALTON COMMUNITY.

 ACTIVITIES:COMPONENT 1: REVIEW AND UPDATE ADMINISTRATIVE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES NOT REVIEWED IN THE PREVIOUS GRANT; REVIEW/UPDATE AS NEEDED THE EPA - TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN WITH THE EPA PROJECT OFFICER AND COUNCIL AT LEAST ANNUALLY; ATTEND THE ALASKA TRIBAL CONFERENCE ON ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT, AND THE ALASKA FORUM ON THE ENVIRONMENT, AND THE DECEMBER GAP WORKSHOP.

COMPONENT 3: COLLABORATE WITH A VARIETY OF TRIBAL, CONSORTIA, GOVERNMENTAL, AND NON-GOVERNMENTAL PARTNERS TO DEVELOP AND EXPAND SUSTAINABLE SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE STRATEGIES; DEVELOP WASTE MANAGEMENT CODES AND ORDINANCES; HOLD A COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL MEETING TO DISCUSS THE INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN AND THE LONG TERM PLANS FOR STEVENS VILLAGE'S SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM. ESTABLISH MECHANISMS TO ASSURE A FINANCIALLY SUSTAINABLE WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM.
COMPONENT 4: APPLY THE PRINCIPLES AND PROCESSES IN THE INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN TO THE CURRENT PRACTICES, FACILITIES, AND ISSUES IN THE COMMUNITY; PARTICIPATE IN RURAL ALASKA LANDFILL OPERATOR TRAINING OR REFRESHER; HIRE AN EQUIPMENT OPERATOR TO CLEAN LANDFILL AREA (COVER, FILL, AND CONTAINMENT OF WASTE); IMPLEMENT SUSTAINABLE MATERIALS MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES; AND COLLECT AND STAGE ITEMS/MATERIALS IN THE DESIGNATED AREA FOR BACKHAUL. CONDUCT BACKHAUL WHEN ENOUGH MATERIALS HAVE BEEN STAGED.

OUTCOMES: 
BUILDING ADMINISTRATIVE GRANTS MANAGEMENT CAPACITY WILL ESTABLISH A SUSTAINABLE PROGRAM THAT WILL ADDRESS LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES FOR A HEALTHIER COMMUNITY
HAVING A WELL-INFORMED AND SUPPORTIVE COMMUNITY WILL IMPROVE HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH IN STEVENS VILLAGE.
STAFF, COUNCIL, AND COMMUNITY UNDERSTANDING OF SOLID WASTE ISSUES, THEIR CONSEQUENCES, AND THE NEED FOR NEW ACTIONS WILL PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP.
IMPLEMENTING THE PRACTICES AND PROCESSES ESTABLISHED IN THE IWMP WILL RESULT IN AN EFFICIENTLY MANAGED LANDFILL THAT WILL MINIMIZE WASTE AND IMPROVE HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH IN STEVENS VILLAGE.

DESCRIPTION:TELIDA VILLAGE WILL USE GAP FUNDING TO BUILD ADMINISTRATIVE AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY, BUILD TRIBAL CAPACITY TO PREPARE FOR CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS THROUGH BASELINE MONITORING, ASSESSMENT, AND PLANNING; AND ESTABLISH COLLABORATIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH RESEARCH PARTNERS AND OTHER NATIVE ALASKAN TRIBES IN THE UPPER KUSKOKWIM REGION TO ENHANCE PARTNERSHIPS AND FACILITATE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MAINTAINING TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE AND COMPLETING GRANT ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES, UPDATING TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, ATTENDING RELEVANT TRAININGS, ESTABLISHING PERMAFROST STUDY SITES TO COMPLETE BASELINE CLIMATE CHANGE MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPROVED QAPP, COMPLETING SITE VISITS TO COLLECT DATA, DISSEMINATING BASELINE DATA RESULTS TO COUNCIL AND EPA, CONNECTING WITH TRIBES AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY PARTNERSHIP OPPORTUNITIES, AND ATTENDING RELEVANT TRAININGS THAT ALIGN WITH TELIDA'S ETEP.
