PROGRESS WILL BE REPORTED ON IN QUARTERLY REPORTS, AND DELIVERABLES INCLUDE LISTS OF CALLS/MEETINGS, RESEARCH DOCUMENTS, LISTS OF TRAININGS ATTENDED, UPDATED POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, TRIP REPORTS, BASELINE DATA RESULTS, CONSULTANT AGREEMENTS, AND PHOTOS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS TELIDA VILLAGE.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT ARE TO:
1: ADVANCE AND EXPAND TRIBAL CAPACITY, COMMUNITY AWARENESS, AND SUSTAINABILITY OF SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PRACTICES. A BACKHAUL TRAILER WILL BE PURCHASED TO SUPPORT REMOVAL OF JUNK CARS AND MATERIALS THAT NEED TO BE DISPOSED OF IN SPECIFIC WAYS, SUCH AS FREEZERS, BATTERIES AND OLD OFFICE EQUIPMENT. CONTINUE RECYCLING PROGRAM AND TRASH HAUL;
2: ENHANCE ADMINISTRATIVE PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND ENVIRONMENTAL OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO KEEP COMMUNITY INFORMED AND ENGAGED ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND SOLUTIONS. ADVANCE GAP PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT THROUGH ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF'S ATTENDANCE AT CONFERENCES, TRAINING; AND
3: REESTABLISH THE WATER QUALITY BASELINE SAMPLING PROGRAM AND COMPLETE THE CREATION OF A DATABASE FOR FUTURE REFERENCE. IT WILL TAKE AT LEAST 4 - 5 YEARS OF SAMPLING TO ESTABLISH MEANINGFUL BASELINE DATA.
ACTIVITIES:COMPONENT 1: CONDUCT A WASTE ASSESSMENT, REVIEW AND UPDATE THE INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN, COLLABORATE WITH OTHER TRIBES, CONSORTIA, AND ORGANIZATIONS TO BUILD A SUSTAINABLE WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, CONTINUE TRASH HAUL  IN THE COMMUNITY, EXPAND THE COMMUNITY RECYCLING PROGRAM, PURCHASE SOLID WASTE REMOVAL EQUIPMENT ( A TRUCK AND TRAILER), GET TRAINING ON BACKHAUL BEST PRACTICES AND HAZWOPER, AND RENT, LEASE, OR PARTNER WITH AN ENTITY THAT OWNS A COMPACTOR TO CRUSH VEHICLES FOR BACKHAUL. 
COMPONENT 2: HIRE AND TRAIN STAFF FOR THE ENVIRONMENTAL COORDINATOR AND ENVIRONMENTAL ASSISTANT POSITIONS; SCHEDULE 2 COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL MEETINGS/ACTIVITIES AND 2 SCHOOL VISITS TO PROVIDE ENVIRONMENTAL OUTREACH AND EDUCATION; ENVIRONMENTAL COORDINATOR, ENVIRONMENTAL ASSISTANT WILL ATTEND THE ALASKA TRIBAL CONFERENCE ON ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT AND THE DECEMBER GAP WORKSHOP; A COUNCIL MEMBER WILL ATTEND ALASKA TRIBAL CONFERENCE ON ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT AND ALASKA FORUM ON THE ENVIRONMENT  TO NETWORK WITH PEERS AND LEARN ABOUT THE LATEST ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND STRATEGIES; AND DEVELOP NEWSLETTERS FOR QUARTERLY DISTRIBUTION TO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS AND ENCOURAGE  ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP. 
COMPONENT 3:EC/EA WILL TAKE WATER SAMPLING TRAINING/REFRESHER IN ANCHORAGE ALASKA; EC/EA WILL CONTINUE TO SAMPLE 1-2 SITES ON THE YUKON RIVER AND ASSESS THE DATA WITH ASSISTANCE FROM YUKON RIVER INTER TRIBAL WATERSHED COUNCIL AND/OR TANANA CHIEFS CONFERENCE; EC/EA WILL CONDUCT SAMPLING AT 1 SITE IN THE BIRCH CREEK AREA; AND EC/EA WILL ATTEND A WATER QUALITY CONFERENCE/TRAINING IN FAIRBANKS OR ANCHORAGE TO STAY UP TO DATE ON CURRENT ISSUES AND TECHNOLOGIES.
 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES: COPIES OF WASTE ASSESSMENT, UPDATED INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN, LANDFILL LOGS, BACKHAUL STATISTICS., PHOTOS, TRIP/TRAINING REPORTS, NEWSLETTERS, WATER QUALITY
STATISTICS/REPORTS.

OUTCOMES: 
-	WASTE MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, INCLUDING CONDUCTING PERIODIC BACKHAULS, WILL HAVE LONG TERM ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS FOR THE COMMUNITY.  
-	EDUCATING THE COMMUNITY, GAP EMPLOYEES, AND STUDENTS ON ENVIRONMENTAL TOPICS SUCH AS PROPER WASTE REMOVAL, RECYCLING, WATER QUALITY, AND AIR QUALITY WILL CHANGE BEHAVIORS AND IMPROVE LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL AND HUMAN HEALTH.
-	BASELINE DATA WILL BE USED TO EXPAND OUR KNOWLEDGE BASE AND HELP PROTECT WATER QUALITY AND RESIDENTS IN CIRCLE.

BENEFICIARIES: COMMUNITY OF CIRCLE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE NULATO TRIBE TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL BUILD A STRONG ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE WITH THE CAPACITY TO SUCCESSFULLY MANAGE THE GRANT AND HELP THE COMMUNITY RESOLVE ITS ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES; EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ABOUT AIR QUALITY ISSUES THROUGH GENERAL MEETINGS, NEWSLETTERS, FLYERS, AND BROCHURES; AND WORK WITH THE CITY OF NULATO ESTABLISH A PROGRAM TO MINIMIZE WASTE, INCLUDING HOUSEHOLD WASTE, USED OIL WASTE, JUNK VEHICLE REMOVAL, WHITE GOODS REMOVAL, TIRES REMOVAL, AND SNOW MACHINE REMOVAL.ACTIVITIES:THE TRIBE WILL SUBMIT GRANT REPORTING, ATTEND ENVIRONMENTAL CONFERENCES IN PERSON, AND PURCHASE SUPPLIES AND OTHER MATERIALS FOR ENVIRONMENTAL ACTIVITIES; ATTEND AIR QUALITY TRAININGS ONLINE, SHARE AIR QUALITY INFORMATION WITH THE COMMUNITY, AND COMPILE A REPORT FOR THE CITY OF NULATO ON METHODS TO IMPROVE DUST CONTROL; AND APPLY FOR THE ALPAR GRANT TO REMOVE LITTER FROM THE COMMUNITY, DO BI-WEEKLY LITTER PATROLS, PICK UP TRASH MONTHLY, ASSIST THE CITY OF NULATO WITH BACKHAUL, PARTICIPATE IN MONTHLY SOLID WASTE TELECONFERENCES, HOST 2 COMMUNITY CLEAN-UPS, AND MEET WITH CITY ADMINISTRATOR TO DISCUSS WAYS TO STAY IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION'S LANDFILL REQUIREMENTS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE PROGRESS REPORTS, THE ANNUAL SF-425, TRIP REPORTS, NEWSLETTERS, FLYERS, A BROCHURE, A DUST CONTROL REPORT, A COPY OF THE ALPAR GRANT, PHOTOS, AND A BACKHAUL INVENTORY. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE BETTER WORKING RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE TRIBAL ADMINISTRATOR AND ACCOUNTANT AND KNOWLEDGE AND COMPLETION OF GRANT REQUIREMENTS; IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING BY GAP STAFF OF INDOOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES AND SOLUTIONS, AND IMPROVED ABILITY BY COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO MAINTAIN INDOOR AIR QUALITY IN THEIR HOMES; AND BETTER CO-MANAGEMENT WITH THE CITY OF NULATO OF THE LANDFILL AND BACKHAUL, A CLEANER COMMUNITY, AND IMPROVED KNOWLEDGE OF SOLID WASTE ISSUES AND SOLUTIONS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY OF THIS GRANT IS THE NULATO TRIBE.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: 1. PROGRESSIVE ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT WILL STRENGTHEN THE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM; 2. WORKING WITH COMMUNITY PROVIDING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION BY EXPLORING A VARIETY OF ENVIRONMENTAL TOPICS AND ISSUES WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO ENCOURAGE INVOLVEMENT IN ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND PROJECTS. FOCUS ON THE PRIORITIES IN THE TRIBE'S ETEP AND CURRENT WORKPLAN; 3. CONTINUE TO IMPROVE SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH PARTNERS, TRAINING FOR STAFF, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION. CONTINUE TO CONDUCT PUBLIC EDUCATION, AWARENESS, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, AND INFORMATION EXCHANGE ON ISSUES RELATED TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; 4. CONTINUE TO EXPAND AND IMPROVE THE SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM USING OPTIMAL PRACTICES AND THE LATEST TECHNOLOGIES; AND 5. ENHANCE CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION PLANNING AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLANNING/PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT BY COLLABORATING WITH A VARIETY OF ORGANIZATIONS TO IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH AND SUSTAINABILITY.ACTIVITIES:COMPONENT 1: ALASKA TRIBAL CONFERENCE ON ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT AND THE ALASKA FORUM ON THE ENVIRONMENT CONFERENCES WILL BE ATTENDED BY THE ENV. COORDINATOR AND ENV. ASSISTANT. THE EA WILL BE TRAINED/SUPERVISED BY THE EC. ENVIRONMENTAL MEETINGS, WORKSHOPS, AND WEBINARS WILL ATTENDED BY THE EC AND EA. THE ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT WILL COLLABORATE WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS ON WASTE MANAGEMENT, CLIMATE CHANGE, AND OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES. THE EC WILL REVIEW THE EPA-TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN AND UPDATE IT AS NEEDED. ENVIRONMENTAL AND ADMIN STAFF AND COUNCIL MEMBERS WILL REVIEW/UPDATE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. 
COMPONENT 2: PROGRAM TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS, AS APPROPRIATE, DISPROPORTIONATELY HIGH AND ADVERSE HUMAN HEALTH OR ENVIRONMENTAL EFFECTS OF TRIBAL PROGRAMS, POLICIES, AND ACTIVITIES ON MINORITY POPULATIONS AND LOW-INCOME POPULATIONS WITHIN THE TRIBE'S AREA OF PROGRAM RESPONSIBILITY
COMPONENT 3: EC WILL TRACK AND ORDER SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE SUPPLIES, TOOLS, AND EQUIPMENT. EC WILL WORK WITH ORGANIZATIONS TO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WITH ACTIVITIES LIKE COMMUNITY CLEAN UP. EA WILL ACQUIRE HAZARDOUS MATERIAL HANDLING CERTIFICATIONS. EC AND EA WILL REVIEW/UPDATE THE SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN. 
COMPONENT 4: GAP STAFF WILL PUBLICIZE CLEAN UP EVENT, AND APPLY FOR AND SUBMIT ALPAR APPLICATION AND POST FLYERS, POST ON KANGIRNARMIUT CAURALLRIT FACEBOOK PAGE. TRIBE HAS ESTABLISHED A PROGRAM TO MEANINGFULLY PARTICIPATE IN WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED BY OTHER TRIBAL, FEDERAL, STATE, OR LOCAL GOVERNMENTS (INCLUDING REVIEWING AN COMMENTING ON WASTE DISPOSAL FACILITY PERMITS AND APPLICABLE WASTE MANAGEMENT REGULATIONS). OUTREACH METHODS THAT WILL BE USED TO REACH AND SOLICIT INPUT FROM POTENTIALLY AFFECTED COMMUNITY MEMBERS COMMUNITIES.
COMPONENT 5: GAP STAFF WILL HELP REDUCED IMPACTS OF HAZARDOUS WASTE IN THE COMMUNITY AND WITHIN HOMES BY CREATING COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF RISK OF HAZARDOUS WASTE AND TO EDUCATE ON PROPER HAZARDOUS WASTE HANDLING AND REMOVAL FROM HOMES AND COMMUNITY.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:COMPLETE EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH AND QUARTERLY REPORTING REGARDING PLANS ACCOMPLISHMENTS, ISSUES, AND ACTIVITIES- CREATE AND DISTRIBUTE QUARTERLY FLYERS AND QUARTERLY REPORTS AND SUBMIT TO EPA PROJECT OFFICER, TRIBAL COUNCIL, ADMINISTRATOR AND TRIBAL MEMBERS. GAP STAFF WILL COLLECT DATA AND CREATE AN INVENTORY OF HOMES IN NEED OF WEATHERIZATION/RENOVATION AND 
ATTEND THE HEALTHY HOMES TRAINING, WHILE WORKING WITH ANTHC AND COMPLETE ASSESSMENTS THAT INCLUDE MEASUREMENTS OF ALL ISSUES IDENTIFIED IN EACH HOME. GAP STAFF WILL CONTINUE WASTE COLLECTION AND BURNING WASTE AND ENTER NON BURNABLES AND BURNABLE WASTE BAG ONTO LOGSHEET AND SUBMIT TO EPA PROJECT OFFICER IN QUARTERLY REPORTS. ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM WILL PUBLICIZE CLEAN UP EVENT, APPLY FOR AND SUBMIT ALP

DESCRIPTION:THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF KOBUK CONTINUES TO BUILD TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY WHILE TRAINING, PRESENTING TO THE COMMUNITY AND WORKING ON THE SOLID WASTE ISSUES AT THE LANDFILL AND THE AREAS SURROUNDING THE LANDFILL. THE TRIBE WILL FOCUS MORE ON THE CLIMATE CHANGE ISSUES DIRECTLY AFFECTING THE KOBUK RIVER CAUSING THE WATER TO BE TURBULENT AND EROSION HAS REACHED MORE EXTREME SHORELINE DEGRADATION. THIS ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD A FINANCIAL STRUCTURE AND REVIEW FUNDING OPTIONS FROM ADDITIONAL FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL ENTITIES FOR ASSISTANCE AND PARTNERSHIPS TO PROVIDE FOR AND ENVIRONMENTALLY PROTECT RESIDENTS CONTINUING TO BUILD A CLEANER AND HEALTHIER COMMUNITY. ACTIVITIES:THIS ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD A FINANCIAL STRUCTURE AND REVIEW FUNDING OPTIONS FROM ADDITIONAL FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL ENTITIES FOR ASSISTANCE AND PARTNERSHIPS TO PROVIDE FOR AND ENVIRONMENTALLY PROTECT RESIDENTS CONTINUING TO BUILD A CLEANER AND HEALTHIER COMMUNITY. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:A CLEANER HEALTHIER COMMUNITY IS ANTICIPATED AS THE TRIBE IDENTIFIES BEHAVIOR CHANGES, CLEAN UP REQUIREMENTS, AND CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION PLANS FOR THE FUTURE. THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY WILL FOCUS ON AWARENESS, THROUGH EDUCATION AND PLANNING.

DESCRIPTION:THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF CHUATHBALUK WILL USE FY23 GAP FUNDING TO MANAGE THE GRANT AND BUILD CAPACITY BY HANDLING ADMINISTRATIVE ASPECTS OF THE GRANT; ADDRESS SOLID WASTE PLANNING AND CAPACITY BUILDING BY IMPROVING MANAGEMENT OF HAZARDOUS WASTE, RECYCLABLES, AND BACKHAUL MATERIALS OUT OF CHUATHBALUK; EDUCATE COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND ENGAGE YOUTH THROUGH ENVIRONMENTAL OUTREACH AND LEADERSHIP ACTIVITIES, AND DEVELOP A STRATEGY FOR AIR QUALITY EDUCATION. ACTIVITIES:PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SUBMITTING QUARTERLY REPORTS AND DELIVERABLES, COORDINATING A BACKHAUL EVENT, WRITING A TRIBE-CITY MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT ON SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT, WRITING HANDOUTS TO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON AIR QUALITY, ESTABLISHING A YOUTH PROGRAM TO IDENTIFY ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES IN CHUATHBALUK, COLLECTING RECYCLABLES FROM RESIDENTS, AND FACILITATING OUTREACH FOR A COMMUNITY EARTH DAY EDUCATIONAL EVENT.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: COPIES OF ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION HANDOUTS, NEWSLETTERS PUBLISHED IN CHUATHBALUK ANNOUNCEMENTS, PRESENTATION PICTURES, LISTS OF TRAININGS, TRIP REPORTS, AND AN INVENTORY SHEET OF ITEMS SHIPPED, DRIVEN, OR FREIGHTED OUT THAT WILL BE SENT TO EPA. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE THAT GAP STAFF WILL HAVE CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM, EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY, AND PROVIDE SOLUTIONS TO ONGOING PROBLEMS TO THE COMMUNITY OF CHUATHBALUK.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: 1. CONTINUE TO BUILD AND EXPAND ADMINISTRATIVE GRANTS MANAGEMENT; 2. PROGRAM EXPANSION AND ADVANCEMENT IN SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT; 3. CONTAMINATED SITES: PLANNING, RESEARCH, AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT; AND 4. YOUTH ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND OUTREACH.
ACTIVITIES:COMPONENT 1: THE ENVIRONMENTAL COORDINATOR WILL ATTEND THE ALASKA TRIBAL CONFERENCE ON ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT, ALASKA FORUM ON THE ENVIRONMENT, QUARTERLY REGIONAL GAP AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM MEETINGS AND WEBINARS WITH COPPER RIVER NATIVE ASSOCIATION, MONTHLY GAP NETWORKING CALLS WITH ALASKA NATIVE TRIBAL HEALTH CONSORTIUM, COPPER RIVER REGION GAP STAFF MEETINGS, RECYCLING OUR AREAS RESOURCES (ROAR) MEETINGS, AND YOUTH ENVIRONMENTAL SUMMIT PLANNING MEETINGS. EC WILL COMPLETE PROGRAM PROGRESS AND FINANCIAL REPORTS, AND TRAINING, CONFERENCES, AND WEBINARS TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR CLIMATE CHANGE, SOLID WASTE, COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, YOUTH INVOLVEMENT, WATER QUALITY, CONTAMINATED SITES, AND OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL TOPICS.
COMPONENT 2: ORGANIZE A SPRING CLEANUP TO EDUCATE COMMUNITY MEMBERS ABOUT BEST PRACTICES FOR RECYCLING AND LITTER REDUCTION, CONTINUE IMPLEMENTING SOLID WASTE FEES FOR THE TRANSFER SITE, CONDUCT QUARTERLY RECYCLABLES BACKHAUL, HIRING TWO LABORERS TO ASSIST. EC WILL WORK WITH COPPER RIVER NATIVE ASSOCIATION TO BACKHAUL LARGER ITEMS SUCH AS VEHICLES,  APPLIANCES, ELECTRONICS, TIRES, ETC. AND MAINTAIN A SPREADSHEET TO TRACK THE MATERIALS BACKHAULED, AND INSTALL FENCING AROUND COMMUNITY DUMPSTERS TO HELP KEEP ANIMALS OUT.
COMPONENT 3: THE ENVIRONMENTAL COORDINATOR AND TRIBAL ADMINISTRATOR WILL HOLD A COMMUNITY MEETING ON CONTAMINATED SITES, EDUCATE COMMUNITY ON SPILL PREVENTION, FUEL SPILLS, AND BURIED MATERIAL THROUGH ARTICLES IN A QUARTERLY ENVIRONMENTAL NEWSLETTER, AND WORK WITH YUKON RIVER INTERTRIBAL WATERSHED ON BASELINE SOIL SAMPLING AT CONTAMINATED SITES USING AN EPA APPROVED QAPP, AND ATTEND TRAININGS/WEBINARS ON CONTAMINATION, HAZWOPER, AND BROWNFIELDS.
COMPONENT 4: HOLD AN ENVIRONMENTAL MEETING QUARTERLY FOR THE YOUTH, TOPICS WILL INCLUDE CLIMATE CHANGE, WATER QUALITY, ETC.; ATTEND 3-DAY YOUTH ENVIRONMENTAL SUMMIT WITH  STUDENTS FROM MENTASTA K-8TH GRADES; WORK WITH THE SCHOOL TO DO SPRING ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECTS WITH THE KIDS; COORDINATE WITH COPPER RIVER WATERSHED PROJECT TO DO FIELD TRIPS WITH YOUTH TO DIFFERENT BODIES OF WATER TO SAMPLE WATER LEVELS, TEMPERATURE AND PH LEVELS; HIRE TWO YOUTH WORKERS FOR THE SUMMER TO JOB SHADOW THE ENVIRONMENTAL COORDINATOR; AND 
WORK WITH THE SCHOOL AND YOUTH TO KEEP DATA ON TEMPERATURE AND WEATHER CHANGES TO SHOW HOW A WARMING CLIMATE EFFECTS OUR REGION

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES: COPIES OF TRIP REPORTS, MEETING MINUTES, PHOTOS  SPREADSHEET OF TRASH BAGS/RECYCLABLES COLLECTED, SOLID WASTE FEE SPREADSHEET , SPREADSHEET OF NUMBER OF ITEMS REMOVED FROM VILLAGE AND VEHICLES BACKHAULED, MEETING SIGN IN SHEETS, HANDOUTS, QAPP, PRESENTATIONS, WEATHER SPREADSHEET.

OUTCOMES: 
-	ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF ARE TRAINED AND KNOWLEDGEABLE OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, AND PROJECTS THAT ARE BETTER MANAGED TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT
-	SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE IS BACKHAULED, PROVIDING A CLEAN AND HEALTHY LIFESTYLE THAT PROTECTS THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF OUR COMMUNITY 
-	AS COMMUNITY MEMBERS BECOME MORE KNOWLEDGEABLE ON CONTAMINATION, FUEL SPILLS, AND BROWNFIELDS, STEWARDSHIP AND BEHAVIORS PROTECTIVE OF THE ENVIRONMENT WILL IMPROVE HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH IN MENTASTA.
-	YOUTH WITHIN THE COMMUNITY ARE AWARE OF A CHANGING ENVIRONMENT AND HOW THEY CAN HELP PREVENT ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS 

BENEFICIARIES: COMMUNITY OF MENTASTA

BUILD AIR AND WATER QUALITY TECHNICAL CAPACITY TO INFORM JOINT EPA-TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN (ETEP) REFINEMENT AND PRIORITY SETTING.ACTIVITIES:WORKPLAN ACTIVITIES WILL INVOLVE ADMINISTRATIVE CONTINUED CAPACITY BUILDING AS WELL AS TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY BUILDING. COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION CHANGES BEHAVIOR PATTERNS, ENABLING BOTH EPA AND THE TRIBE TO PROTECT THE HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. OUTCOMES WILL INVOLVE ADMINISTRATIVE CONTINUED CAPACITY BUILDING AS WELL AS TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY BUILDING. THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE CRITICAL SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS BY BACKHAULING WASTES WHICH PREVENTS CONTAMINATION BY UNIVERSAL WASTES INTO WATERWAYS AND ON LAND. COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION CHANGES BEHAVIOR PATTERNS, ENABLING BOTH EPA AND THE TRIBE TO PROTECT THE HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.  OVERALL, THESE EFFORTS WILL SERVE THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY FOR YEARS TO COME.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE ORGANIZED VILLAGE OF GRAYLING TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER AN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM ON INDIAN LANDS.  ACTIVITIES:THE ORGANIZED VILLAGE OF GRAYLING WILL COMPLETE (1) ADMINISTRATIVE/PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY BUILDING, INCLUDING COMPLETING ANNUAL GRANT REQUIREMENTS, ATTENDING TRAININGS, AND UPDATING THE STAFF MANUAL; (2) SOLID WASTE AND RECYCLING PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, INCLUDING COLLECTING AND SHIPPING OUT RECYCLING AND OTHER SOLID WASTE (BACKHAUL), LANDFILL CLEANUP, PURCHASING SUPPLIES, AND UPDATING THE SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN; (3) AIR QUALITY/HEALTHY HOMES CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT, INCLUDING DEVELOPING A CLEAR PLAN FOR IMPROVING INDOOR AIR QUALITY IN HOMES WORKING WITH EPA AND ITS PARTNERS, AS WELL AS PURCHASING, DISTRIBUTING, AND EDUCATING COMMUNITY MEMBERS ON AIR MATTERS TOOLKITS AND FOLLOWING UP A MONTH OR TWO LATER TO SEE IF PEOPLE ARE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OR NEED ANY HELP; AND (4) ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, INCLUDING CONDUCTING ENVIRONMENTAL ACTIVITIES IN THE SCHOOL, SUCH AS MAKING GREEN CLEANERS TO SHARE WITH THE COMMUNITY, AND SHARING RESOURCES WITH THE SCIENCE TEACHER, CREATING A QUARTERLY NEWSLETTER AND OTHER OUTREACH MATERIALS, ORGANIZING ACTIVITIES FOR EARTH DAY, INVOLVING STUDENTS IN THE LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL OBSERVER (LEO) NETWORK, AND SHARING INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES: QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS, TRIP REPORTS, SF-425, PHOTOS, QUARTERLY NEWSLETTER, INVENTORY OF GOODS PREPARED DRAINED OF FREON
OUTCOMES: EFFECTIVE GRANTS MANAGEMENT AND COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, EXPLORING NEW BACKHAUL METHODS AND COLLECTION AND RECYCLE PROGRAMS/PROCESSES  IMPROVING AIR QUALITY, AND IMPROVING THE COMMUNITY'S UNDERSTANDING OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES WILL IMPROVE THE ENVIRONMENT AND HUMAN HEALTH IN GRAYLING. 
BENEFICIARIES: THE ORGANIZED VILLAGE OF GRAYLING AND ITS TRIBAL MEMBERS

BBNA WILL TRAIN TRIBES ON GRANT MANAGEMENT AND ENVIRONMENTAL PLANNING. BBNA WILL ALSO TRAIN AND ASSIST TRIBES WITH WATER QUALITY AND CLIMATE CHANGE PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT.
 SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:BBNA WILL COMMUNICATION WITH PROJECT OFFICER AND REPORT ON ACTIVITIES AND FINANCIAL UPDATES. BBNA WILL HELP TRIBES BECOME MORE SELF SUFFICIENT ON GRANT MANAGEMENT AND HELP TRIBES DEVELOP WATER QUALITY AND CLIMATE CHANGE PROGRAMS.

DESCRIPTION:DURING THE NEXT FOUR YEARS, MANIILAQ ASSOCIATION CONTINUES TO ASSIST MEMBER TRIBES IN BUILDING CAPACITY WITH A SYSTEM TO STORE AND ORGANIZE DATA AND INFORMATION COLLECTED OR GENERATED BY THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM FOR FUTURE USE IN CHARACTERIZING ENVIRONMENTAL AND HUMAN HEALTH CONDITIONS, RESPONDING TO INFORMATION REQUESTS, DEVELOPING ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECTS/INITIATIVES, OR OTHER PROJECT MANAGEMENT DATA SYSTEMS. THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM HAS DEVELOPED MAPPING GIS (GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM) CAPABILITIES. PROGRAM WILL IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS, AS APPROPRIATE, DISPROPORTIONATELY HIGH AND ADVERSE HUMAN HEALTH OR ENVIRONMENTAL EFFECTS OF MEMBER TRIBAL PROGRAMS, POLICIES, AND ACTIVITIES ON MINORITY POPULATIONS AND LOW-INCOME POPULATIONS WITHIN THE TRIBE'S AREA OF PROGRAM RESPONSIBILITY. STAFF HAS COMPLETED TRAINING AND ACQUIRED BASELINE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS RELATED TO THE CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA) AND SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT (SDWA) BUILDING TRIBAL CAPACITY TO BECOME FAMILIAR WITH THE MAJOR GOALS, PROGRAMS, AND REQUIREMENTS OF THE CWA AND SDWA; THE NATIONAL STRUCTURE FOR IMPLEMENTING THE CWA AND SDWA; AND THE EPA REGIONAL PERSONNEL AND ORGANIZATION.
ACTIVITIES:DURING THE NEXT FOUR YEARS, MANIILAQ ASSOCIATION CONTINUES TO ASSIST MEMBER TRIBES IN BUILDING CAPACITY WITH A SYSTEM TO STORE AND ORGANIZE DATA AND INFORMATION COLLECTED OR GENERATED BY THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM FOR FUTURE USE IN CHARACTERIZING ENVIRONMENTAL AND HUMAN HEALTH CONDITIONS, RESPONDING TO INFORMATION REQUESTS, DEVELOPING ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECTS/INITIATIVES, OR OTHER PROJECT MANAGEMENT DATA SYSTEMS. STAFF WILL WORK WITH MEMBER TRIBES TO ALSO COMPLETE TRAINING AND ACQUIRE BASELINE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS RELATED TO THE CWA AND SDWA BUILDING TRIBAL CAPACITY TO BECOME FAMILIAR WITH THE MAJOR GOALS, PROGRAMS, AND REQUIREMENTS OF THE CWA AND SDWA; THE NATIONAL STRUCTURE FOR IMPLEMENTING THE CWA AND SDWA; AND THE EPA REGIONAL PERSONNEL AND ORGANIZATION.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM HAS DEVELOPED MAPPING GIS (GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM) CAPABILITIES. DESCRIPTION:
THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD CAPACITY REGARDING ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES FACING THE TRIBE, AND CONTINUE EFFORTS TO REMEDIATE AND ELIMINATE DANGEROUS AND POLLUTION FROM OUR LANDFILL AND THE AIR. THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF SHISHMAREF WILL COMMUNICATE OUTDOOR AND INDOOR AIR POLLUTION ISSUES, CLIMATE CHANGE FACTS, IMPACTS AND CHALLENGES, AND CONTINUE LANDFILL CONTAINMENT AND RECYCLE PROGRAMS. THE SHISHMAREF ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM STAFF WILL ATTEND TRAINING TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH IN THE COMMUNITY AND INCREASE AWARENESS OF AIR POLLUTION SOURCES. THE TRIBE WILL FOLLOW AND UPDATE THE SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN, WORK WITH STATE AND LOCAL ENTITIES TO CONTINUE TO PERMIT AND MAINTAIN THE LANDFILL. BEHAVIOR CHANGES WILL BE REALIZED THROUGH EDUCATION REGARDING AIR IMPACTS, THE LANDFILL, RECYCLING EFFORTS AND PRESENTATIONS. THIS PROGRAM PROJECT PLAN WILL COVER MORE THAN FOUR YEARS OF CAPACITY BUILDING, LOCATING FUNDING RESOURCES, PLANNING AND PROJECT BUILDING.  

ACTIVITIES:
TRAINING, EDUCATING TRIBAL MEMBERS THROUGH PRESENTATIONS, NEWSLETTERS, AND SERVICES. DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO BUILD TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY TO DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP PROGRAMS ON SAINT PAUL ISLAND. RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT BASELINE AIR AND WATER MONITORING VIA EPA APPROVED METHODOLOGIES TO ACHIEVE AN UNDERSTANDING OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS AND POTENTIAL IMPACTS THAT NEED IMPROVEMENT.  ACTIVITIES:RECIPIENT WILL BUILD TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY THRU SPECIFIC INTERNAL STAFF TRAINING. RECIPIENT WILL ALSO FOCUS ON LOCAL TRIBAL STAFF SUPPORT, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TRAINING FOR ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND RESILIENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT OF A SUSTAINABLE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM.  RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT BASELINE AIR AND WATER MONITORING VIA EPA APPROVED METHODOLOGIES TO ACHIEVE AN UNDERSTANDING OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS AND POTENTIAL IMPACTS THAT NEED IMPROVEMENT. THE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT WILL INCREASE IT'S CAPABILITY TO MANAGE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS BY FOCUSING ON THE FOLLOWING KEY AREAS: BUILDING ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY, TRIBAL TECHNICAL TRAINING AND COLLABORATIVE DISCUSSIONS/LEARNING WITH PARTNER TRIBES, DEVELOP WATER QUALITY MONITORING CAPACITIES, SOLID WASTE/MARINE DEBRIS PUBLIC OUTREACH, AND BUILDING CAPACITY TO SUPPORT LOCAL RECYCLING. SEVERAL SPECIFIC OUTPUTS WILL BE A RESULT OF THESE ACTIVITIES, AND ALL ACTIONS WILL BENEFIT TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF AND LOCAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS FOR A HEALTHIER SUBSISTENCE LIFESTYLE.

THIS AWARD'S PURPOSE ARE: COOPERATIVE OUTREACH AND DEVELOPMENT, TRADITIONAL KNOWLEDGE-BASED BASELINE MONITORING, PROGRAM INSTITUTIONALIZATION AND SUSTAINABILITY.  THE ACTIVITIES ARE: 
REVIEW LITERATURE ON BODY CONDITION OF SUBSISTENCE SPECIES AND THE CONNECTION TO ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGE, WATER QUALITY AND CONTAMINATION ISSUES; RECRUIT AND TRAIN MEMBER(S) OF PARTICIPATING TRIBES TO ASSIST WITH OUTREACH, DEVELOPMENT OF QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP) AND BASELINE DATA COLLECTION TO BETTER UNDERSTAND HOW ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGE IMPACTS KEY SUBSISTENCE SPECIES; BUILD CAPACITY FOR PROGRAM TO BASELINE MONITOR LOCAL OBSERVATIONS OF CHANGING ANIMAL CONDITION; BUILD CAPACITY FOR BIOLOGICAL INVESTIGATION OF UNDERLYING ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS AND IDENTIFY FUNDING SOURCE(S) FOR LONGER-TERM CONTINUATION OF PROGRAM.

PURPOSE AND ACTIVITIES ARE TO BUILD TRIBAL CAPACITY TO DEVELOP AND MANAGE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENT PROGRAM DEVELOP AN ETEP COMMUNITY OUTREACH NETWORK WITH REGIONAL ORGANIZATIONS AND DEVELOP A COMPOSTING PROGRAM. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES ARE TO DEVELOP ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM TECHNICAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE CAPABILITIES; PRODUCE AN EPA TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN AND COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL OUTREACH MATERIALS; AND LEARN FROM PEER TO PEER MEETINGS AND ENVIRONMENTAL TRAININGS AND WORK WITH COMMUNITY TO DEVELOP SOLID WASTE REDUCTION/COMPOSTING PROGRAM.  INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS THE CLARK'S POINT VILLAGE AND TRIBAL MEMBERS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THIS GAP PROJECT INCLUDE:

1. EXPANDING THE GAP GRANTS MANAGEMENT SYSTEM TO ENHANCE PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT. REVIEWING/UPDATING TRIBAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, PROVIDING TRAINING AND CONFERENCE PARTICIPATION OPPORTUNITIES FOR STAFF, AND CONDUCTING COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ON THE EPA-TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN PRIORITIES.

2. EXPANDING AND ADVANCING SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES TO DEVELOP A SELF-SUSTAINING PROGRAM.

3. PLANNING, RESEARCH, AND TAKING THE INITIAL STEPS TO ESTABLISH AIR QUALITY AND WATER QUALITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS IN TANACROSS. 

ACTIVITIES:COMPONENT 1: MEETINGS, TRAINING AND CONFERENCES WILL BE ATTENDED TO EXPAND ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF'S KNOWLEDGE BASE AND INCREASE PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY; PROVIDE COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION, INCLUDING A QUARTERLY NEWSLETTER AND WEEKLY FACEBOOK UPDATES; EDUCATE THE YOUTH AND COMMUNITY ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES; HOST AT LEAST TWO COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL MEETINGS; ORDER OFFICE AND PROGRAM SUPPLIES; DEVELOP A BUDGET TRACKING SYSTEM IN EXCEL; DEVELOP/UPDATE ADMINISTRATIVE AND TECHNICAL PROCEDURES, POLICIES, REGULATIONS, AND OTHER GUIDELINES TO IMPLEMENT THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM; AND REVIEW OF THE EPA-TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN ANNUALLY BY THE EC, COUNCIL, AND PROJECT OFFICER.
COMPONENT 2: HOST A COMMUNITY CLEANUP DAY/ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION EVENT ABOUT HOW LITTERING NEGATIVELY IMPACTS THE LAND AND ANIMAL; NETWORK WITH A VARIETY OF PARTNERS TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES FOR AN EFFICIENT, COST EFFECTIVE, AND INTERNALLY SUSTAINABLE SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM; ATTEND SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE TRAININGS AND CONFERENCES VIA ZOOM OR IN PERSON WHEN OFFERED; IMPLEMENT THE PRIORITIES IN THE UPDATED INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN TO EXPAND AND IMPROVE THE SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM; LOCATE A PLACE FOR A NEW LANDFILL AND CLOSE THE OLD ONE; LANDFILL OPERATOR WILL OVERSEE THE DROP OFF AT THE LANDFILL; WORK WITH THE VILLAGE RESIDENTS ON RECYCLING AND BACKHAUL OF LARGE ITEMS; AND DO ROUTINE MAINTENANCE ON THE LOADER AND THE DUMP TRUCK.
COMPONENT 3: CONDUCT INTERNET RESEARCH ON AIR AND WATER QUALITY TOPICS AND PARTICIPATE IN RELATED WEBINARS, CONFERENCES, AND TRAINING; COLLABORATE WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS  ON AIR  AND WATER QUALITY TOPICS; HOST AIR AND WATER QUALITY ACTIVITIES WITH THE COMMUNITY; WORK WITH THE BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT AND THE US FOREST SERVICE TO LEARN ABOUT PREVENTION OF WILDFIRES. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES: COPIES OF QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS, TRIPS REPORTS, MEETING NOTES, PHOTOS, BUDGET TRACKING SYSTEM SPREADSHEET, PRESENTATIONS, AGENDAS, MEETING NOTES, UPDATED INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN, SOLID WASTE FEE STRUCTURE, WEEKLY WASTE DISPOSAL OPERATIONS REPORTS.

OUTCOMES: 
-	EFFICIENT ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT OF THE IGAP PROGRAM WILL ADVANCE PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY AND ULTIMATELY BENEFIT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT IN TANACROSS.       
-	A WELL-MANAGED, SUSTAINABLE WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM WILL RESULT IN A SAFER, CLEANER ENVIRONMENT AND IMPROVED HUMAN HEALTH.
-	BUILDING THE COMMUNITY'S KNOWLEDGE BASE ON AIR AND WATER QUALITY  PROTECTION WILL PROMOTE INCREASED STEWARDSHIP OF THESE RESOURCES AND BETTER HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH.

BENEFICIARIES: COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND THE ENVIRONMENT OF TANACROSS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE PUEBLO OF NAMBE TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS. ACTIVITIES:SPECIALLY, PUEBLO WILL: PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR ENVIRONMENTAL INVESTIGATIONS, STUDIES, AND DAY-TO-DAY PROGRAMMATIC OPERATIONS.  DETERMINE FUTURE ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT PROGRAM DIRECTION FOR THE TRIBE.  ENHANCE NAMBE'S DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND NATURAL RESOURCE'S CAPABILITIES TO PROTECT AND PRESERVE THE WATER RESOURCES OF THE PUEBLO OF NAMBE, PROVIDE A TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR THE PUEBLO TO OPERATE AND MANAGE AN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM TO PROTECT AND PRESERVE THE ENVIRONMENT OF THE PUEBLO.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS, ANNUAL FEDERAL FINANCIAL REPORT, QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN, AND GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATIONAL SYSTEM/GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM QAPP. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS THE  PUEBLO OF NAMBE.

THIS AWARD WILL PROVIDE GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (GAP) FUNDS TO THE STOCKBRIDGE-MUNSEE COMMUNITY IN SUPPORT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES.  THE FUNDS WILL ENABLE THE TRIBE TO ASSESS, MONITOR AND DEVELOP STRATEGIES FOR PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES DURING THIS PERIOD INCLUDE: ADMINISTRATIVE OVERSIGHT OF THE GAP PROGRAM, LEGISLATIVE AND REGULATORY CAPACITIES, AND COORDINATION OF TRAININGS, OUTREACH, AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES. NOTE THAT THE HEADER OF THIS AWARD CAPTIONS IT AS A GRANT AGREEMENT, WHEREAS, IT IS A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. EPA IS IMPLEMENTING A NEW GRANT SYSTEM THAT WILL SOON BE UNDERGOING ENHANCEMENTS TO ALLOW FOR MORE ACCURATE DESCRIPTIONS.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS GRANT ACCORDING TO THE INDIAN GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM ACT OF 1992 (IGAP) IS TO COVER THE COST OF PLANNING, DEVELOPING, ESTABLISHING, AND BUILDING CAPACITY FOR ELIGIBLE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS.  THE RECIPIENT WILL CONTINUE PROJECTS TO PROVIDE OVERSIGHT OF THEIR GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.

THIS ACTION APPROVES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $110,00 TO THE EASTERN BAND OF CHEROKEE INDIANS TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS.  SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL PURCHASE A HYDRO-MET MONITORING STATION AND A NEXT GENERATION AIR QUALITY MONITORING SYSTEM, AS WELL AS SUPPORTING TRAVEL TO A STORMWATER MANAGEMENT AND EROSION CONTROL TRAINING.

THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $110,000 TO THE MICCOSUKEE TRIBE OF INDIANS OF FLORIDA TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL CONTINUE BUILDING SOLID WASTE, HAZARDOUS WASTE, AND UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK CAPACITIES; BUILDING CORE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION PROGRAM CAPACITIES; AND BUILDING THEIR TRIBAL CONTAMINATED SITE REMEDIATION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM. PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT YOUR ORGANIZATION MUST NOT DRAW DOWN FEDERAL FUNDS FOR INDIRECT COSTS UNTIL IT RECEIVES AN APPROVED RATE FROM ITS COGNIZANT AGENCY.
